```

)}

title: Table: Reordering (drag/drop) does not work if new columns are passed after initial render
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

The current table component allows for column reordering when the `columnReorder` prop is set to true. When enabled, passing a new `columns` array to the table that contains additional columns after initial render displays the new columns, but they cannot be reordered via drag/drop or keyboard.

![2024-08-27_14-46-29](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/4801e95f-9055-4744-a83f-c5799b1bea3a)

```
// add a new column on button click
let newColumnCount = 0;
document.querySelector('#add-column').addEventListener('buttonClick', () => {
  newColumnCount++;
  const table = document.querySelector('modus-table');
  table.columns = [
    ...table.columns,
    {
      header: `New Column ${newColumnCount}`,
      accessorKey: `newColumn${newColumnCount}`,
      id: `new-column-${newColumnCount}`,
      dataType: 'text',
    },
  ];
});
```

### Reduced test cases

https://stackblitz.com/edit/vitejs-vite-j621zu?file=index.html

title: Table: Option to validate and pass error message for each table cell
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [Modus style guidelines](https://modus.trimble.com/components/web/introduction/)

### Proposal

- Introduce an event `cellInputValueChange` that fires on input value change as the user type. This will be useful for consumers who wants to implement custom validation
- Introduce an optional `errors` property that allows the consumer to pass the error message for each cell. 

```
interface TableCellErrors {
  [rowIdorIndex: number]: { // if id is present in row data, use that, otherwise use index
    [accessorKey: string]: string;
  };
}
```

**Acceptance criteria:**
- The component should emit cellInputValueChange event for every change in the input field 
- Updates to error object should be immediately reflected in the Table component
- Should set the cell error state even if the user changes focus - useful if the validation is done in the backend. 
- The documentation should include the possible options, and clearly describe how cellInputValueChange and cellValueChange differs.

### Motivation and context
Consumer side validation and custom error message is already possible in the input components, we are simply extending the behavior for table inline editing. As a next step, we should also consider validation inside the input components.

### What is the issue regarding ?

@trimble-oss/modus-web-components

High

description:

### Describe the issue

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a245d670-bc52-4753-a623-b22fc334d3dd)

A regression was introduced impacting the sizing of the rowSelection column for ModusTable. It now seems to act a fluid box or something strange, though I don't see anything in css. It might be the internal width calculation.

I can reproduce this in our project by simply changing the installed version of modus.

You can work around it by manually setting the width of the other columns, though this is pretty terrible.

#2014 might be relevant/fix. Unsure though.

title: Datepicker: Add "position" property to control component placement relative to the wrapped item
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [Modus style guidelines](https://modus.trimble.com/components/web/introduction/)

### Proposal

Introduce an optional 'position' property that allows the component to be positioned relative to the item it is wrapping. it should accept various positioning options such as top, bottom, left, right, and auto, similar to how tooltips are positioned.

**Acceptance criteria:**
- By default, the date picker position should be bottom to ensure backward compatibility.
- The component should reposition seamlessly during page or container scroll.
- The documentation should include the possible options and their default values.

### Motivation and context

By introducing a dedicated position property, we can simplify the process and make it more intuitive for developers to align components accurately. This change will improve the flexibility and usability of the component, ensuring that it integrates seamlessly with various layouts and use cases.

@trimble-oss/modus-web-components

title: Table: Retain cell error state even if the focus is changed
description:
In current implementation, the cell error styling and message is only persisted when the cell is in edit mode. If the user clicks away or edits a different cell then the previous cell error border and message is removed. Ideally the error state of the cell should be retained until the user corrects the cell value. 

**Acceptance Criteria**
- No changes to the existing prop or events
- Table cell in error state should be identified using red border and a error message if the input is focused.
- Table cell in error state should only retain the red border if the focus is changed.

title: Table: Context Menu-Only Row Actions
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [Modus style guidelines](https://modus.trimble.com/components/web/introduction/)

### Proposal

The current table component displays a number of row actions inline within a designated column. Once the inline space is exhausted, additional actions are placed within a context menu dropdown. This feature request proposes the ability to move all row actions to the context menu dropdown, removing them from the inline display entirely.

**Requirements:**
1. **Context Menu-Only Actions:**  
   - Provide an option to configure the table so that all row actions are placed within the context menu dropdown, with none displayed inline.
   
2. **Icons in Context Menu:**
   - Ensure that icons can be displayed next to individual row actions within the context menu.
   - Allow customization of icon colors within the context menu to give the consumer more control.

### Motivation and context

title: Table - Autocomplete & Date cellEditorType : dropdown is hidden behind grid container (date and select)
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

When using the autocomplete within the Modus Table, the dropdown that is extended is hidden behind the grid. I expect the dropdown to be in front of the grid. 

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1c621ef6-d60b-4d3a-81bd-a0a66faf7f45)

To Reproduce: 

1. Setup a modus table with 1-2 records (small grid size) and configure one of the columns and set `cellEditorType`: "autocomplete" or "date". 

example:
```
{...
      cellEditable: true,
      cellEditorType: 'autocomplete', // or 'date'
      cellEditorArgs: {
        options:[
          { display: 'Cost center1' },
          { display: 'Cost center2' },
          { display: 'Cost center3' },
          ]        
      },
```
2. Try to open the dropdown. 
3. The dropdown will appear behind the grid container.

title: Modal: primary and secondary buttons emit events incorrectly on keyboard inputs
description:
Issue Summary
On clicking the primary button using the Enter key, the button emits  `secondaryButtonClick` event.
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cd147b15-b705-4240-9df4-22eaacd5101c)

Expected Result
The primary and secondary buttons should only emit their corresponding events.

Observed Result
The primary button emits a secondary button event, and vice versa.

Acceptance Criteria
On clicking the primary button, it should emit a `primaryButtonClick` event.
On clicking the secondary button, it should emit  a `secondaryButtonClick` event

Decisions

title: Table: add a maxWidth to the row actions column
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [Modus style guidelines](https://modus.trimble.com/components/web/introduction/)

### Proposal

For tables with a small number of columns, the row actions column might become too large, and there is no way of controlling it, since there are no width properties the user can set.
This column could have a fixed width calculated by the number of actions in it. This already happens for tables with lots of columns, the row actions are fixed at the end of the row with a pre calculated width

Few columns and unnecessary large row actions width:

title: Table : Autocomplete input error styling
description:
Issue Summary

- Update error message style for Auto complete on Table
- Auto complete should fire an event  `valueError` on error input values

Expected Result

- Auto complete Error message style to be updated as per figma and should be displayed as tooltip outside the cell

Observed Result

- The current autocomplete displays error message inside the cell

Acceptance Criteria

- The Auto complete input should fire `valueError` Event when the error text prop is given.
- The new styling should match the figma design

Decisions

- Emit the value Error event on error user input and create a tooltip to handle error message.

Test Cases 

- not Applicable

The example currently uses onClick.

title: Navbar: Prop to ID the Navbar component
description:
**Issue Summary**
In the Navbar component, add a prop for id which, when not set, uses the component id.

**Expected Result**
The Navbar component should have a prop for id, and if not set, it should use the component id.

**Observed Result**
The Navbar component currently does not have a prop for setting a custom id.

**Acceptance Criteria**

Add a prop for id to the Navbar component.
If the id prop is not set, the component should use the component id.

**Decisions**
Add a prop for id to the Navbar component. If the id prop is not set, use the component id.

**Story Points**
1

**Unit Tests Required**
No

**Regression Required**
No

**Impacted Features / Modules**
Navbar

title: SPIKE: Table keyboard navigation - Validate and document how its configured today
description: Common keyboard commands are tab, shift + tab, enter, shift + enter.  Evaluate what we do and do not handle today for keyboard navigation. Compare with other grids like AG Grid to see if we have any gaps or irregular choices.  Output of this should be table of all keyboard interactions and what they do and any gaps we need to fill.  Also consider how google sheets navigates cells as a separate consideration.

title: Table: Handle valueError from input cell editor
description: Issue #2711 introduces the valueError to input fields.  We want to update the styling of error handling to match what was done with the date picker in #2615.

title: Input: Fire valueError event on error
description:
The date picker was updated to fire a `valueError` event on validation failure, we want to do the same with inputs.

References #2615

title: Autocomplete: Handle dynamic options
description:
Add a prop to Autocomplete that will accept a function that returns the array of items.  We should expect a promise to be returned so we can have a loading state. Will need UX decision on loading state, so if not finalized then it can be another story later.  We should debounce the calls such that it won't continuously fire events on every keystroke, give a 300ms delay.

```js
async (input) => { return Promise.resolve([]); }
```

title: Add Accessibility Guidelines to Storybook
description:
- Add a link to the Accessibility Guidelines (https://modus.trimble.com/foundations/accessibility/)
- Currently, we have one line of information about Accessibility in StoryBook ("Better Accessibility - Consistent accessibility enables differently-abled users to have a great experience."). We should have more information how we handle WCAG AA compliance and include the requirements in our dev process. 
- Also, we should bring attention to the Accessibility check panel for each component.

Suggestion from Ryan Kuhn: 
"It would be nice on the summary page to explain in a little more detail what accessibility standard(s) are implemented and that its inherently scanned and violations appear on the storybook tab for each component. There's a few on my team at least that aren't familiar with the storybook setup and what that 'accessibility' tab means."

### Describe the issue

1. Rowoptions column width needs to be small and fixed, right now it is 90 px

title: Table: Datepicker constrained by container
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/91a52f00-8fe0-4ae2-a2f6-dc8626b690b1)
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/68ce4718-2231-49c2-86df-e89f942e1533)

The datepicker is constrained entirely within the table's container, making it difficult or impossible to use depending on the location of the date field and the size of the container.

I would expect the datepicker to not be constrained by the container, as the location of the datepicker relative to its input is not critical, and this greatly impacts usability.

I've included screenshots of the storybook site and also the project I'm working on, where the effects are exacerbated by the small size of the table.

title: File Dropzone "acceptFileTypes" Property - Drop Zone Accepts Anything
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

# DESCRIPTION
An issue with the File Dropzone element, specifically with the "accept-file-types" property. When a user drags files to upload their images and I have set accept-file-types=".jpg,.jpeg,.png", the user is still able to drag or select other types of files (.pdf, .docx, etc.). This causes the element to incorrectly count that a file has been uploaded. Additionally, if the "multiple" attribute is set to "false", even uploading a correct file type after "uploading"  an incorrect file type results in an error. Currently there is no logic in the onDrop handler to honor the setting.  So the drop zone accepts anything, while the file input only accepts the defined times. Moreover, this similar occurs when if a user chooses to "browse to upload", if the user decides to upload an incorrect file type then a similar error will occur. 
 
 
 # DEMO
### DEMO PARAMETERS
accept-file-types  = ".jpg,.jpeg,.png"
multiple = "false"

### DEMOS

**"Drag Files Here" Demo**

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5c6fe0bc-6571-45f1-8094-44a360e73fae


**"Browse to Upload" Demo**


https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d133c82d-bc7f-4a37-9207-246115098d83

title: Select: Initial loading of modus-select elements in angular does not seem to work properly
Modus navbar dropdown should allow manual update on item select
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [Modus style guidelines](https://modus.trimble.com/components/web/introduction/)

### Proposal

Currently the modus navbar dropdown controls its own state. When an item is selected it emits the item for the consumer to use and immediately sets the dropdown value. There are use cases where the consumer needs to control the value update (or if it even gets updated at all).

### Motivation and context

One use case where we don't want to update the dropdown value on selection is when we want to open a new tab and leave the old tab unchanged. In this case the consumer will open a new tab and handle selection.

### What is the issue regarding ?

@trimble-oss/modus-web-components

title: Date Picker: Enable display of valid & invalid dates
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [Modus style guidelines](https://modus.trimble.com/components/web/introduction/)

### Proposal

Add an optional input property that accepts a list of dates which will be displayed in the date picker as clickable; dates not in the passed in list are displayed as disabled. An alternate solution could be to expose an isDateEnabled function, which the user can then pass in to handle their specific logic. This is how Ionic handles the same type of functionality: https://ionicframework.com/docs/api/datetime#advanced-date-constraints

### Motivation and context

We have a use case where the user has to select a date window to display machine data across. Machines however don't have data available every day; it would thus be useful to provide some visual affordance to guide the user towards picking days that actually do have data available, instead of picking dates and seeing an error message pop up.

### What is the issue regarding ?

@trimble-oss/modus-web-components

### Priority

Medium

### What product/project are you using Modus Components for ?

WorksOS / Machine Playback

title: Borderless table should have bottom line
description: The implementation of borderless tables in web components is incorrect. The borderless table rows should always have a bottom line (see Figma).

title: Actions vs Property Changes
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [Modus style guidelines](https://modus.trimble.com/components/web/introduction/)

### Proposal

In most components such as the Navbar, instead of setting properties after render such as `showMainMenu` there is an action method such as `hideMainMenu`.

In the Utility Panel, the example suggests using an `expanded` property and setting it after rendering to control the expanded / collapsed state. Shouldn't this be a method to encapsulate post-render functionality?

Not sure what's the best here but I'm seeing an inconsistency.

title: Modus Side Nav: option to replace click handlers with anchor tags and URLs
description:

### Proposal

Users want to be able to middle mouse click or right click and open in new tab from the navigation. For this to work we need anchor tags with URLs in nav `<li>`. I propose an optional way to swap the provided click handlers with anchor tags.

### Motivation and context

Make the modus side nav more user friendly for opening links.

title: Button Group: By default the first button should be selected
description:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [x] I have read the [Modus style guidelines](https://modus.trimble.com/components/web/introduction/)

### Proposal

This is how the first button should be selected by default on starting the application and then later the select can be changed onclick of other buttons.
![buttongroup](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/164128344/0f41c7ae-8abb-41d2-b300-0feb9ee6a21e)



### Motivation and context

When the user opens the application, no button is selected by default. As a result, the user has to manually select a button each time they enter. To enhance the UI, it is better to have a default button selected. This way, the user can still choose to select other buttons if needed, but they won't have to make an initial selection every time they open the application.

title: Modus 0.31.1 changes the default icon color to transparent
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

After upgrading to @trimbleinc/modus-bootstrap@0.31.1 I encountered that the icons that are loaded through the modus-button are transparent.

![image](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/116563683/7c2d07c3-8a20-425b-89f6-551403c09390)


It looks like the import of the modus.min.css is now required to set the default colors, which wasn't the case in older versions.

My current workaround is to load the css from `@trimble-oss/modus-web-components/dist/modus-web-components/modus-web-components.css` manually.



### Reduced test cases

**Steps to reproduce:**
- Create a project without loading the modus-web-components.css
- Add: `<modus-button button-style="borderless" color="secondary" icon-only="pencil" />`
- The button is shown, but is fully transparent untill the user hovers over it.

**Example repo:**
The issue is reproducible in https://github.com/janwiebe-glasbergen/modus-button-bug

The main.component uses two modus components, modus-icon and modus-button.

If you run a `npm install` and `ng serve` in this repo you will see that the fill of the modus-button is set to transparent.

It will work fine when you do either one of these workarounds:
- Downgrade to 0.30.0 it is working fine.
- Extend the styles array in angular.json with:  `./node_modules/@trimble-oss/modus-web-components/dist/modus-web-components/modus-web-components.css`

### What operating system(s) are you seeing the problem on?

Windows

### What browser(s) are you seeing the problem on?

Chrome

### What is the issue regarding ?

@trimble-oss/modus-web-components

### What version of npm package are you using ?

0.31.1

Medium

Nova / Construction calculation platform UI

title: Autocomplete: Improve handling for when to open lists by default
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [Modus style guidelines](https://modus.trimble.com/components/web/introduction/)

### Proposal

When focusing due to tabbing into the component, the options will not show by default. Setting show-items-on-focus to true will override this, and show the options in this case. This is the only affect show-items-on-focus has on the component.
When clicking to focus the component, the options will always show. There will be no way to disable this.
When focused and options not open, down arrow key press will open the options.
https://modus.ideas.aha.io/ideas/MOD-I-84

### Motivation and context

This is to align with other existing components and how they function, also improves usability.

title: Forced-Colors Mode Issues
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

The Forced-Colors mode is an OS-setting within operating systems. There are a number of problems with out components with this setting enabled.

- Close button is barely visible in dark mode
- Dropdowm toggles not visible in light mode
- Progress bar not visible at all (light and dark mode)
- Radio buttons check status not visible at all (light and dark mode)
- Select icon not visible in dark mode
- Slider track not visible at all (light and dark mode)
- Spinner Animation not visible
- Switch status not visible
- Tooltip Arrow not visible

## Useful Links

- MDN: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/@media/forced-colors
- Smashing Magazine article https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2022/03/windows-high-contrast-colors-mode-css-custom-properties/
- Microsoft Edge Blog: https://blogs.windows.com/msedgedev/2020/09/17/styling-for-windows-high-contrast-with-new-standards-for-forced-colors/

### Reduced test cases

https://coliff.github.io/modus-web-components-example/

You can simulate the `forced-colors: active` mode in Edge (in Rendering panel). be sure to check both light and dark mode using the `prefers-color-scheme` option too.

Windows

title: Autoformat code with Prettier (VS Code setting)
Modus Autocomplete - Required to know selected options Ids with event/property (chips | multple)
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [Modus style guidelines](https://modus.trimble.com/components/web/introduction/)

### Proposal

As of now, the autocomplete emits two events as follows
**optionSelected** => emits selected option ID 
**valueChange** => emits the selected option values as comma-separated string
As per these events, we don't have any option to know the option ID when is removed/de-selected

### Motivation and context

This is a basic feature available in the DevExtream [Tag Box](https://js.devexpress.com/Angular/Documentation/ApiReference/UI_Components/dxTagBox/Configuration/#onValueChanged) component. As part of migration, this is blocking us.

### What is the issue regarding ?

@trimble-oss/modus-web-components, @trimble-oss/modus-angular-components

title: Modus Select should have the option to pick multiple values
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [Modus style guidelines](https://modus.trimble.com/components/web/introduction/)

### Proposal

Modus does not have a component which allows user to choose multiple options from a dropdown. Modus Select should have another prop 'multiple' which when set to true, allows user to choose multiple items which are then removed from the dropdown. 

The styling of options could mimic React Select


![example](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/44625221/b6ea6d26-e778-49e9-a22f-5d5c9fd75bd6)

### Motivation and context

title: Problem: Storybook previews aren't always 100% reflective of the compiled/distributed styles
description:
I've noticed several times where a components styles appear in Storybook 100% correct and as intended, but then when a release ships we discover issues as components display differently. (e.g. #2579)

I think it could be helpful to somehow have that `sample.html` copied to the Storybook site so we can view it somehow without the Storybook styles/overhead. Something a bit like this:
https://coliff.github.io/modus-web-components-example/

but the URL would be something like:
https://modus-web-components.trimble.com/sample-page.html

I don't know what the paths for these files would be though:

```html
<script type="module" src="build/modus-web-components.esm.js"></script>
<script nomodule src="build/modus-web-components.js"></script>
<link rel="stylesheet" href="build/modus-web-components.css" />
```

title: Input focus states not working as intended
description:

- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

The latest release includes changes for all inputs to have a visual 2px primary blue border on focus. However is it not rendering for most of them.

Demo: 

Time Picker styles are working:
```css
.modus-time-picker .input-container:focus-within {
    box-shadow: 0 0 0 1px var(--modus-input-bottom-line-active-color, #217cbb);
    border-color: var(--modus-input-bottom-line-active-color, #217cbb);
}
```

Text Input styles are NOT working:
```css
.modus-text-input .input-container:focus-within {
    box-shadow: 0 0 0 1px var(--modus-input-border-color, 0.0625rem solid var(--modus-input-bottom-line-active-color, #217cbb));
    border-color: var(--modus-input-border-color, 0.0625rem solid var(--modus-input-bottom-line-active-color, #217cbb));
}
```

### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

The modus-navbar component renders a `<div class="main-menu">` that has a border value set. That border is visible when rendering a custom main menu in the main-menu slot. I suggest either removing the border if it was unintentional (could be a breaking change) or add an option to hide the border.

Default usage
![Screenshot 2024-06-06 145109](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/83187108/27008409-b015-4eef-8c46-e54b44e6cd53)

Updated `border-color: red` for visibility

title: Autocomplete: setting value to empty string or null is not removing the option class 'selected'
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

The autocomplete option list shows the previously selected option highlighted after setting the `value `property to an empty string or null.
Steps to reproduce:
1. Select any option
2. Set the autocomplete value property to '' or null using Javascript.
3. Open the list of options

Expected result: No option is highlighted.

Current result: The previously selected option is highlighted.


### Reduced test cases

https://codepen.io/yosuan8718/pen/XWGbbKa?editors=1010

![image](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/48927186/ece4c9f1-61e5-46b9-bfd0-575e4a1a7ca3)

Modus uses the state `selectedOption `to include the class `selected`. This state is only updated when clicking the clearable icon (x) or selecting an option. It must be updated when setting the `value` property too.

### What operating system(s) are you seeing the problem on?

_No response_

title: Autocomplete: Multiple values unrecognized from option list
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

When using Modus autocomplete with multi-select, the component behaves inconsistently based on initialization. If initialized with a single option, it recognizes  the value from list of options, allowing further selections. With no initial value, users can select options from the list, which are styled as chips. 
However, if initialized with multiple options (as a comma-separated list), the component fails to recognize them, displays a "no results found" message, and prevents further selections. Ideally, the autocomplete should recognize comma-separated values from the list, display them as chips, and allow additional selections.

### Reduced test cases

https://codepen.io/Anaith-A/pen/KKLdLjO?editors=1010

title: Checked checkboxes should have `checked="true"` and not `aria-checked="true"`
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

The current behaviour is problematic.

- Checked checkboxes should have `checked="true"` (and not `aria-checked="true"`)
- Unchecked checkboxes should have `checked="false"` (and not `aria-checked="false"`)

Deque university has more details on this:
https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.9/aria-conditional-attr?application=AxeEdge

### Reduced test cases

Run Axe Core scan on: https://coliff.github.io/modus-web-components-example/

title: Content Tree: Set draggable on tree, not item
description: If draggable is set on the content tree, then all items are draggable. Don't deprecate the existing item level property at this time.  There still may be value and we can still honor an item being draggable false.

title: [Modus-table] tableCore is called before it's initialized
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

When using the modus table component an error occurs in the console:
```
TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'setState')
    at ModusTable.onDataChange (modus-table.entry.js:3931:24)
    at index-8e730124.js:1811:54
    at Array.map (<anonymous>)
    at setValue (index-8e730124.js:1808:34)
    at HostElement.set [as data] (index-8e730124.js:1859:25)
    at NoneEncapsulationDomRenderer.setProperty (platform-browser.mjs:645:17)
    at elementPropertyInternal (core.mjs:10980:18)
    at Module.ɵɵproperty (core.mjs:21752:9)
```

This seems to occur because the `tableCore` of the modus-table is used before it's intialized. 

### Reduced test cases

The issue is reproducible by going to https://modus-web-components.trimble.com/?path=/story/components-table--default and switch to the hover option
![Bug](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/116563683/ae158406-67bf-40d4-aab3-21505f793d7d)


### What operating system(s) are you seeing the problem on?

Windows

0.22.0

title: SPIKE: Determine how to handle checkbox and row action column widths with full width
description:
References: #1922 

Goal of this issue is to find a solution to maintaining the proper column widths for the checkbox and row action columns when the table is full width, columns have defined widths, but the sum of the widths is less than the page width, leading to columns being stretched.  Refer to #1922 for a screenshot and other details.

title: SPIKE: Add custom sorting function to table columns
description:
References: #1602
https://tanstack.com/table/latest/docs/guide/sorting

Define what the function needs to be that is passed to `sortingFn` such that the end user can define their own custom sorting functions.  Ideally they would pass a function like `(a, b) = > { // implementation }`. 

Document the shape of the expected function and if we need or want to simplify it.

title: Button Group Events Wrong
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

The button group DOM Events (https://modus-web-components.trimble.com/?path=/docs/components-button-group--default) are documented as:
- buttonClick
- selectionChange

These aren't correct as they should be:
- buttonGroupClick
- buttonSelectionChange

What's interesting though is 'buttonClick' does fire but doesn't have any event data.

Finally, it is a deviation from most other functionality to have a HTML element be included in the DOM event, which it is for both buttonGroupClick and buttonSelectionChange. It adds fragility when working with frameworks.

### Reduced test cases

title: Docs: Radio group Canvas example should have controls
description:
Right now we have a Canvas demo of Medium radio-group (https://modus-web-components.trimble.com/?path=/story/user-inputs-radio-group--medium) and small radio group (https://modus-web-components.trimble.com/?path=/story/user-inputs-radio-group--small).

I think it'd be good to have a single canvas but with Controls available with options:

- Aria-label
- Disabled
- Name
- Size (Medium or small)

Adding controls allows the user to test the different options and states and makes accessibility testing easier.

title: Remove border radius and top border from List Item
description:

- [X] I have read the [Modus style guidelines](https://modus.trimble.com/components/web/introduction/)

### Proposal

Individual list items all have a border radius and full border. When combined in a list item group, the border radius and extra borders remain. They should be styled to how the style guide demonstrates.

### Motivation and context

This will be needed to align the current Modus list item web component with how it is expected to look and behave in the Modus Style Guide.

title: Autogenerated files are not being gitignored.
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

When making a change to the project and running `npm run build`, files for Angular and React are autogenerated.   These show up on the stage when running `git status`.

How to reproduce:
1. Make a fresh branch
2. Make an update to a component's interface.
3. Run `npm run build`
4. Run `git status` (or check the Source Control section of VSCode)

Expected result: Only the files manually updated are in the stage.
Actual result: In addition to manually updated files, angular and react files are updated.

### Reduced test cases

In terminal/command line:

```
git rm <files to be gitignored>
git rm -r <directories to be gitignored>
```

In .gitignore:
```
angular-workspace/
react-workspace/
<any additional files that need to be ignored>
```

title: Autocomplete Behavior
description:
https://trimble-arch.aha.io/ideas/ideas/MOD-I-35

1.) New flavor of autocomplete that shows all items when opened (rather than only showing items based on user input). I believe this needs to be a flavor only for the use cases when the list within the autocomplete is way too long. a.) it would confuse the user why everything is showing without knowing any context, and b,) it could take forever to load a potenially irrelevant list. 

2.) Scroll the list to the selected item (to assure user of their selection): once the user selects something from the autocomplete list, and reopens the autocomplete, they should see their selection within the context of the list. The already selected item item shows with a checkmark on the right and is the second one from the bottom of the list. 


**This is going to be addressed in a separate issue:** 
3.) If this is a multliselect autocomplete: show chips ABOVE the input field (not inside). When chips are created, and the field is reopened, the first selection in alphabetical order should be visible as the second from the bottom (unless it's the first one in the list or the last one in the list). 

https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues/2446

description:

title: Localization for Numbers
description:
1. Numerical inputs add a selectable pattern in a global context with option for "." and ","  
allow depending on localisation: 123456789,12345
allow depending on localisation: 123456789.12345 
2. Include option of spaces as a divider. This way users are not confused by multiple "." or "," ( e.g. 123.456.789,12 or 123,456,789.12)
allow depending on localisation: 123 456 789,12345
allow depending on localisation: 123 456 789.12345
3. Add the ability to limit the number of characters before and after a "." or ",". This would ensure that people only enter valid numbers, and would reduce errors.
e.g. 9 characters before and 2 after "." or "," 
allow depending on localisation: 123456789,12
allow depending on localisation: 123456789.12

title: Autocomplete: value of valueChange event is empty string "" even though there's some options selected
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

Currently when some option is selected, both optionSelected and valueChange events are triggered. 
When some option is unselected using chips, only valueChange event is triggered. 
When the string in input area changes, only valueChange event is triggered in this case too.

Value of target/datail of event is "" after erasing the last letter in input, even though there's some options selected. 
Value of target/datail of event is "" after closing the last chip.

So now, we cannot differentiate if the last chip is closed or the last letter of string is erased from input, as both triggers same valueChange event, where eventIn.detail = "" in both cases.

Thus we either need another event for closing chips or value should NOT be "" if there's still some options selected. 

### Reduced test cases

title: Modus Accordion Expand/Collapse integration method
description:
Suggestion; we should change the markup needed for Accordions using CircleArrow icon from:

```html
<modus-accordion>
  <modus-accordion-item header-text="Item 1" expand-button-type="circleArrow">
    Content
  </modus-accordion-item>
  <modus-accordion-item header-text="Item 2" expand-button-type="circleArrow">
    Content
  </modus-accordion-item>
</modus-accordion>
```

to:

```html
<modus-accordion expand-button-type="circleArrow">
  <modus-accordion-item header-text="Item 1"> Content </modus-accordion-item>
  <modus-accordion-item header-text="Item 2"> Content </modus-accordion-item>
</modus-accordion>
```

This will prevent users from mixing and matching expand icons within an accordion (which we don't want) and be simpler, less-code.

cc @cjwinsor @ElishaSamPeterPrabhu

title: Select: Placeholder API/Behavior issues
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

I would like to propose some changes to the Select component's `placeholder` property and its behavior:

**Optional placeholder Implementation**:
The `placeholder` property should be entirely optional. In the absence of  `placeholder`, the Select component should not display any placeholder text. Instead, the "currently selected" value should appear blank, aligning with the behavior observed in other input elements, such as text inputs

**Behavior When placeholder Is Specified**:
When `placeholder` is provided, it should exclusively serve as the "currently selected" value when no actual selection has been made. Importantly, this placeholder should not be included among the dropdown list's selectable options

title: Disabled buttons are ignored by screen readers
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

Accessibilty standards state that if something is visible it must be readable by the screen reader. 
Disabled buttons by default are hidden from screen readers. 

The solution for this is tricky but documented here: https://a11y-101.com/development/aria-disabled 

The solution should result in a button that is disabled (meaning it looks and acts disabled) BUT the screenreader still finds it and reads it as a button that is disabled.

description:

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

For the table (https://modus-web-components.trimble.com/?path=/docs/components-table--default), under the types:

```typescript
interface ModusTableColumn<TData extends RowData, TValue = unknown> {
 ...
  dataType: ModusTableColumnDataType;
 ...
 }

type ModusTableColumnDataType =
  | typeof COLUMN_DEF_DATATYPE_TEXT
  | typeof COLUMN_DEF_DATATYPE_INTEGER
  | typeof COLUMN_DEF_DATATYPE_LINK;
```

There seems to be only text, integer, and link. But in the examples at the top there is a column with the dataType of 'date'. Which one is correct?

```javascript
document.querySelector('modus-table').columns = [
    ...
    {
      header: 'Created At',
      accessorKey: 'createdAt',
      id: 'createdAt',
      dataType: 'date',
    },
  ];
```

description:

title: Dropdown Component Encapsulation
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [Modus style guidelines](https://modus.trimble.com/components/web/introduction/)

### Proposal

I believe that the purpose of componentization is to encapsulate behavior of a group of elements together to perform a specific function. For example, the Table can combine an HTML table along with other modus components (such as pagination) to create a unified experience.

Dropdown I don't feel is this way as it relies on an extra button, passing the id between the dropdown and the button. I think the Dropdown component should already have a button embedded into it and expose the button label. Also using id's can lead to fragile component.

In addition, if `The dropdownList slot was built to work with the <modus-list> and <modus-list-item> elements.`, why not just make dropdown list items a formal component element as opposed to imposing requirements such as `The item size property should be set to 'condensed'.`?

Before:
```html
<modus-dropdown toggle-element-id="toggleElement">
  <modus-button id="toggleElement" slot="dropdownToggle" show-caret="true">Dropdown</modus-button>
  <modus-list slot="dropdownList">
    <modus-list-item size="condensed" borderless>Item 1</modus-list-item>
    <modus-list-item size="condensed" borderless>Item 2</modus-list-item>
    <modus-list-item size="condensed" borderless>Item 3</modus-list-item>
  </modus-list>
</modus-dropdown>
```

After:
```html
<modus-dropdown label="Dropdown">
  <modus-dropdown-item size="condensed" borderless>Item 1</modus-dropdown-item>
  <modus-dropdown-item size="condensed" borderless>Item 2</modus-dropdown-item>
  <modus-dropdown-item size="condensed" borderless>Item 3</modus-dropdown-item>
</modus-dropdown>
```

### Motivation and context

_No response_

@trimble-oss/modus-web-components

title: Navbar: navbar `<nav>` should have an `aria-label`
description:
Navbar needs to have an optional `aria-label` config.

Reason being is that if there is more than one `<nav>` component on the page then we want screen reader to announced that the navbar is 'main menu' or something like that.

title: Slider Emits String Instead of Number
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

A modus slider (even though the value, max, and min are all numeric) emits a string on the valueChange event.

Example:
```html
<body>
    <modus-slider label="Slider"></modus-slider>

    <script>
    const modusSlider = document.querySelector('modus-slider');
    modusSlider.addEventListener('valueChange', (evt) => {
        alert(typeof evt.detail);
    });
    </script>
</body>
```

I would expect the event detail to be a number.

title: Inactive Tabs Error
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

If no tab is set to active = true, click events are broken.

Example:
```html
<body>
    <modus-tabs></modus-tabs>
    <modus-tabs size="small"></modus-tabs>

    <script>
    const modusTabs = document.querySelector('modus-tabs');
    modusTabs.tabs = [
        {
        id: 5,
        label: 'Tab 1',
        },
        {
        id: 1,
        label: 'Tab 2',
        },
    ];
    modusTabs.addEventListener('tabChange', (evt) => {
        alert(JSON.stringify(evt.detail));
    });
    </script>
</body>
```

Upon click this results in:
```
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'id')
    at o.handleTabChange (392.test.bundle.js:1:470)
```

title: Update Accordion Styles (CSS)
description:
We need to update the CSS styles for the Accordions to match the new design specs.

- X-padding for button/header should be 1rem (16px)
- Border-radius: 4px
- New expand/collapse icon (in a solid circle) - (@egunther39 to provide)
- Updated box-shadow

- Note: Adding 'Supporting Label' will require additional development and need a separate ticket for

title: Tooltip: should be dismissible with the `Escape` key
description:
Currently Modus Web Components can't be dismissed with the <kbd>Escape</kbd> key but I think that should be enabled by default.

REF:

- [w3.org/WAI/ARIA/apg/patterns/tooltip/#keyboardinteraction](https://www.w3.org/WAI/ARIA/apg/patterns/tooltip/#keyboardinteraction)

title: Button: Add `type` attribute
description:
We should add the `type` attribute to the button element. The default should be `type="button"`, but user can also choose "`button`", "`submit`" or "`reset`".

REF: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/button#type

It's good practise to always specify the type because the default type is `submit` (not `button` as one might expect).

REF: https://webhint.io/docs/user-guide/hints/hint-button-type/?source=devtools

title: Breadcrumb: Remove unnecessary `role="navigation"` (already implied by using `nav` element)
description: The [breadcrumb component](https://modus-web-components.trimble.com/?path=/docs/components-breadcrumb--default) is a `<nav>` which has `role="navigation"` automatically, no need to define that in addition.

title: Button: Small buttons are not sized correctly
description:

![image](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/1212885/a7a584c9-57c9-4ccb-99cf-d2d8c763bd6a)

We should specify height and width of the button, or set consistent vertical/horizontal padding to fix this issue.

title: Table | Column visibility dropdown list causes extra scrolling when too long
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

Max height is set on the table to support sticky headers. 
When the column visibility is enabled and the list of columns is very long, the list extends beyond the table itself, and causes additional scrolling within the page. 

![image](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/4574058/a17a0208-ce91-4df4-b451-4864e66024ce)

**User Problem**

- Overlooking the Apply button as it is out of the page fold.
- Apply button too difficult to access as it needs long scroll to reach on long list of columns.

**Suggested Solution**
- Update column selection panel MAX-height ~~5% less than table height.
- Fixing the cancel and apply buttons to the bottom of the panel so that they are always visible
- The list of columns with checkboxes will be in the scrollable content of the selection panel.


### Reduced test cases

title: Navbar Menu buttons should be  `<button>`s  (or at least have `role="button"`)
description:
Navbar buttons are announced by screen readers simply as 'clickable' but they should be announced as buttons. Ideally we should use the `<button>` element, but using `role="button"` would suffice.

They should also have `aria-label` set so the name of the button is announced.

description:

title: Accessibility Audit 2024
description:
Fix all accessibility issues:

- Card
  - Cards have `role="article"` which [is not recommended](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Accessibility/ARIA/Roles/article_role) (and not always appropriate) (low priority)
- Checkbox
  - #2514
- Dropdown
  - #1194  (low priority)
- Navbar
  - #1628 
  - #2212 
- Pagination
  - Add `aria-label="Previous"` and `aria-label="Next"` to the SVG images within those buttons (Not on the list items themselves).
- Switch
  - Switch have invalid ARIA attribute value: `aria-checked=""` (Should have true or false)
  - Switch is missing `role="switch"` (not announced by screen readers)
- Tabs
  - Tabs should be buttons (not divs)
- Tooltip
  - #2177

title: Navbar: Make profile optional
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [Modus style guidelines](https://modus.trimble.com/components/web/introduction/)

### Proposal

Add a `show-profile` property to the Navbar, defaulting to `true`. We've decided to default to `true` to avoid introducing a breaking change, while also maintaining consistency with the existing `show-` prefix nomenclature in our properties.

### Motivation and context

There are scenarios where providing the user the option to sign out is unfavorable.  In the known instances, the profile menu is not necessary.  The provided scenarios were:
1. Tekla Assistant window that is opening a website inside a desktop application, providing user details or sign out options does not make sense in this context
2. e-Builder popup windows - Signing out from a popup window does not make sense based on desired user flow. The user should not be able to navigate to another page via profile menu links that take them back to the full page experience inside a popup window.  User delegation feature allows for switching of user context which could create confusion as the main page wouldn't update to reflect immediately.


Although this leads to the ability to use the `buttons` prop to define your own avatar button, this is not a supported use case by the modus design system.  To comply with guidelines, if a profile and profile menu are needed then the built in profile should be used.  

### What is the issue regarding ?

@trimble-oss/modus-web-components

Medium

title: Table Sorting Improvements
description:
- Every table cell needs to be focusable so the screenreader can read the content

- When sorting is enabled within a column, the sort icon must be visible as default (not only on hover)

- The sort icon must have a tooltip

- User can sort by clicking on the header text OR on the sort icon. When sorted, the icon changes and the header text becomes bold. Clicking again reverses the sort order.

- User can click within the cell on empty space, the drag cursor (open hand) shows on hover and once clicked and dragged (cursor changes to closed hand) the column can be reordered. 

- When the user tabs into the column header, the screenreader reads the content of the cell. When the user presses enter, the column header is raised to indicate the user can reorder columns with left/right arrows. 

- When the user tabs again, the focus moves to the sort icon allowing the user to sort by pressing enter. 

**A-Ha! submission for reference:** https://modus.ideas.aha.io/ideas/MOD-I-15

title: [Modus-Table] Pagination is not working when enabled without refreshing
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

The pagination of the modus-table is not working correctly when it get's enabled after the page loaded. 
It looks like the 'showing result' and pages are rendered correctly, but the data in the table is never updated.

After a refresh of the web-page the pagination works like expected.



### Reduced test cases

Steps to reproduce in storyboard canvas:
- Open the default modus-table
- Set the pageSizeList prop to `[2,3,5]`
- Set the pagination prop to `true`
- Pagination is shown, but not working correctly:
  - Before showing the pagination there is a short period in when it shows:  'Showing result NaN - NaN of 5' (see image).
 ![image](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/116563683/8a6573a5-ae15-4e75-9c41-c437de9521d3)
  - Total count shows 'showing result 1 - 2 of 5', but table shows all 5 results.
  - Switching the page doesn't affect the result in the table
  - Switching the page view doesn't affect the result in the table




![invalid table](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/116563683/e3f0f43e-1cdd-45ba-8e1b-7a2b8b0bd3b9)

title: [Modus-Table] Allow translated strings for pagination and sorting.
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [Modus style guidelines](https://modus.trimble.com/components/web/introduction/)

### Proposal

The modus-table component contains some hardcoded English strings. As shown in the below screenshot:
![image](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/116563683/23f0eef2-764b-4476-9343-d08c64c07383)

As a developer I would like to be able to provide custom values for these strings, so that I can support multiple languages.

### Motivation and context

title: Date Picker - Available dates should dynamically update to reflect the latest changes without requiring a manual refresh.
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

**Bug Description:**
The Date Picker component in the Modus Web Components library presents an issue when modifying the minimum and maximum dates using the UI controls. Specifically, when selecting a date that falls below the minimum date or exceeds the maximum date, navigating to available dates in the calendar does not update to reflect the latest changes. A manual refresh of the URL is required to observe the correct behavior.

### Reduced test cases


**Expected Behavior:**
After modifying the minimum and maximum dates and selecting a date outside the valid range, navigating to available dates should dynamically update to reflect the latest changes without requiring a manual refresh.


**Technical Scenario:**

- Access the URL(https://modus-web-components.trimble.com/?path=/story/user-inputs-date-picker--default-with-picker).
- Observe the Date Picker component, focusing on the "default-with-picker" story.
- Modify the minimum date to "2022-12-02" and the maximum date to "2023-01-31" using the Date Picker component UI controls.
- Set the current date value to "2023-12-22."
- Select a date that falls below the minimum date or exceeds the maximum date (e.g., choose a date in December 2022).
- Click on the calendar and navigate to available dates.
- Observe that the calendar displays dates from December 2022, and all dates beyond this month are disabled.
- Manually refresh the URL and verify that the changes are correctly reflected in the calendar.

**Test Data:**

[Test URL](https://modus-web-components.trimble.com/?path=/story/user-inputs-date-picker--default-with-picker)
Existing Minimum Date: 2022-12-02
Existing Maximum Date: 2022-12-30
Current Date Value: 2022-12-22
Updated Maximum Date: 2023-01-31
Updated Current Date Value: 2023-12-22


### What operating system(s) are you seeing the problem on?

Windows

Chrome

title: Accordion: Accessibility Issues
description:
The Accordion component is currently not accessible via screen readers. Changes needed:

- The clickable header should be a button
- The header button should have `aria-expanded="false"` when closed
- The expanded content should have an ID and the button should link to it with `aria-controls` - e.g. `aria-controls="expandedContentID"`

title: Docs: Icon Only Buttons are not announced with screen readers
description:
RE: https://moduswebcomponents.netlify.app/?path=/docs/components-button--icon-only#icon-only-button

Icon-only buttons need `aria-label` otherwise they will simply be announced as button which isn't helpful.

![image](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/1212885/d040efce-14dc-45eb-a856-eac0f8e81813)

In this case the buttons here should have `aria-label="Notifications"`.

title: Modal Accessibility Issues
description:
The Modal Component has a few accessibility issues:

- A closed/unopened Modal should not have `role="dialog"`, that should be added when modal is opened and removed when modal is closed.
- Modal should have `aria-modal="true"` when opened (removed when closed)
- Modal should not have `aria-label` when closed.
- Modal should have `aria-hidden="true"` when closed
- Right now, the `aria-label` has to manually set and is listed as 'optional'. I think it'd be better if the value of the modal title was used automatically. The title would have an id (e.g. `id="contactFormModalTitle"`, and the modal would then have something like `aria-labelledby="contactFormModalTitle"` then no need for aria-label to be used at all (this is what Bootstrap does)

title: Modus Icon: Event Name is `iconClick`, not `onClick` as shown in Storybook and clicking causes error
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

Component creates `iconClick` event
```tsx
  @Event() iconClick?: EventEmitter;
```
But Storybook shows it has having an `onClick` event that is emitted
![image](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/1130129/790dda79-14a1-4c09-a986-bdd381d0b20d)

And when the icon is clicked it produces an error
```
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'emit')
    at Object.onClick (25.cf0f1bcf.iframe.bundle.js:1:2565)
    at IconSun.Object.onClick (0.fb127b46.iframe.bundle.js:1:421530)
```

This is caused by the icons onClick being set as
```html
<IconMap ... onClick={this.onClick} ... />
```
when it should be this at minimum to maintain the `this` context.  
```html
<IconMap ... onClick={() => this.onClick()} ... />
```

Otherwise the context will be the icon from the icon map, not the modus-icon.

I am creating this ticket so I can work on it later.

### Reduced test cases

In Storybook for MWC, navigate to the Icon component and click on the icon. Observer the javascript error in the dev console.

title: Storybook Canvas (demos): Accessibility issues with incorrectly attributed `disabled` attribute
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

The following components demos (Canvas tab) have `disabled="false"` on by default - this should be removed altogether. As it stands all buttons are listed as disabled and are not accessible. This needs to be fixed.

- modus-button
- modus-chip

E.g. On the page: https://modus-web-components.trimble.com/?path=/story/components-button--default the Sentiment scale attribute has:
`<modus-button disabled="false">`

The disabled attribute should be removed otherwise it will be announced as unavailable (disabled)

title: Change Deploy Preview setup (Azure SWA / Netlify)
description:
We currently have both Azure SWA and Netlify setup for deploy previews for pull requests. There are many issues with Azure SWA so we should switch to only using Netlify using the Trimble Enterprise account which we now have access to.

Note: We will continue to use Azure SWA for the production site. There is no need to change that since it works fine and changing the DNS would be troublesome and could result in site downtime.

running `npm run build` from the angular-workspace/test-web-components/ directory on the repo fails with the following error:

```
Error: node_modules/@trimble-oss/modus-web-components/dist/types/components.d.ts:1662:15 - error TS2320: Interface 'HTMLModusBadgeElement' cannot simultaneously extend types 'ModusBadge' and 'HTMLStencilElement'.
  Named property 'ariaLabel' of types 'ModusBadge' and 'HTMLStencilElement' are not identical.

1662     interface HTMLModusBadgeElement extends Components.ModusBadge, HTMLStencilElement {
                   ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


Error: node_modules/typescript/lib/lib.dom.d.ts:4621:101 - error TS2344: Type 'HTMLElementTagNameMap[K]' does not satisfy the constraint 'Element'.
  Type 'HTMLElement | HTMLCanvasElement | HTMLImageElement | HTMLVideoElement | HTMLAnchorElement | ... 112 more ... | HTMLModusTreeViewItemElement' is not assignable to type 'Element'.
    Type 'HTMLModusBadgeElement' is not assignable to type 'Element'.
      Types of property 'ariaLabel' are incompatible.
        Type 'string | null | undefined' is not assignable to type 'string | null'.
          Type 'undefined' is not assignable to type 'string | null'.

4621     getElementsByTagName<K extends keyof HTMLElementTagNameMap>(qualifiedName: K): HTMLCollectionOf<HTMLElementTagNameMap[K]>;
                                                                                                         ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


Error: node_modules/typescript/lib/lib.dom.d.ts:4910:101 - error TS2344: Type 'HTMLElementTagNameMap[K]' does not satisfy the constraint 'Element'.
  Type 'HTMLElement | HTMLCanvasElement | HTMLImageElement | HTMLVideoElement | HTMLAnchorElement | ... 112 more ... | HTMLModusTreeViewItemElement' is not assignable to type 'Element'.

4910     getElementsByTagName<K extends keyof HTMLElementTagNameMap>(qualifiedName: K): HTMLCollectionOf<HTMLElementTagNameMap[K]>;
                                                                                                         ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


```

### Reduced test cases

See above. `"@trimble-oss/modus-web-components": "0.8.0"` works - but `"@trimble-oss/modus-web-components": "0.9.0"` and later does not.

title: Table: Add support for wrapping text
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [Modus style guidelines](https://modus.trimble.com/components/web/introduction/)

### Proposal

The table should allow for the text to wrap, instead of being truncated.  Since the current table is setup to truncate by default, we should leave that.  My suggestion is to add a `wrap-text` property that defaults to `false`.  When enabled, it will remove the css that currently causes the body text to be truncated with ellipsis.  I do not expect this setting to affect the header or the footer.

Additionally, padding needs to be maintained.  Currently, the `<tr>` has its height set relative to its `density`.  Each column type should ensure that it's effective padding is maintained between wrapping and non-wrapping configurations.

Currently looks like this:
![image](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/1130129/e82e1d1b-c11b-484c-9647-9bc3d435e6c6)

After changes, it could look like this:
![image](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/1130129/b7dd3400-ce8b-4b3d-a405-3d8c51eec5fd)


### Motivation and context

Currently columns are displayed which can show a large block of text.  Since this text is truncated, users cannot scan or otherwise search for a specific row based on the value of the cell.  By adding back text wrapping, the table can function the same as a standard table and gives us the control on whether its more valuable to have fixed and predictable row heights, or all the text in the cells being displayed with irregular row heights.

### What is the issue regarding ?

@trimble-oss/modus-web-components

### Priority

Medium

### What product/project are you using Modus Components for ?

e-Builder

### What is your team/division name ?

e-Builder

None

title: Modus table: Pagination - Wrong page shown after adding or removing row
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

In a paginated table, when you remove or add a row, the first page is shown. However the previous page is still selected.

**Steps to reproduce:**
* Create a paginated table
* Navigate to the last page
* Add or remove item from the data array
* Table shows first page, but last page is still selected in the page navigation

![image](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/116563683/b9ce9e10-d3f4-4b3f-b41e-0589d59b2bd6)

**Expected behavior:**
The last/current page should remain visible, also after adding/removing an item. Or first row should be selected in the page navigation after adding/removing an item.

title: Date Picker current date should have `aria-current="date"`
description:
So:

```html
<button class="calendar-day grid-item selected" tabindex="0">22</button>
```

should be:

```html
<button class="calendar-day grid-item selected" tabindex="0" aria-current="date">22</button>
```

REF:
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Accessibility/ARIA/Attributes/aria-current#date

title: Bigger tap target for resizing columns in a table
description:
E-Builder request from Teja: 

Currently, the touch target for resizing columns is very precise, which could create issues for people with dexterity problems. Suggestion: we should add some padding on both sides of the column line (4px on each side for a tap target of 8px).

title: lint-css and prettier scripts are not including all files as intended in linux environments.
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

On a Mac or using WSL, running the commands
```
stylelint src/**/*.scss --fix
prettier --write storybook/stories/**/*.* src/**/*.* --config ../.prettierrc.json --ignore-path ../.prettierignore
```

will not run across all files. Mainly, `src/components` is not included.

By updating to use quotes
```
stylelint "src/**/*.scss" --fix
prettier --write "storybook/stories/**/*.*" "src/**/*.*" --config ../.prettierrc.json --ignore-path ../.prettierignore
```

At least per prettier [documentation](https://prettier.io/docs/en/cli.html): 
> Don’t forget the quotes around the globs! The quotes make sure that Prettier CLI expands the globs rather than your shell, which is important for cross-platform usage.

I'll make this update.

### Reduced test cases

title: The flag "skipLibCheck" must be set to  true in order to build
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

When creating a new project in angular and importing modus controls per instructions build errors will halt the build process unless I set the flag  "skipLibCheck": true, in compiler options within TS config. After doing so there aren't additional build errors. This was reproducible on several different versions of angular from 13 - 17 .  This was directly after creating the angular application with no other imports except the node controls.

title: Table: Manual pagination issue when the initial state is undefined
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

Setting _manualPaginationOptions_ throws an error when the previous state is undefined.

`@Prop() manualPaginationOptions: ModusTableManualPaginationOptions;
  @Watch('manualPaginationOptions') onManualPaginationOptionsChange(
    newVal: ModusTableManualPaginationOptions,
    oldVal: ModusTableManualPaginationOptions
  ) {
    if (
      newVal.pageCount !== oldVal.pageCount ||
      newVal.currentPageIndex !== oldVal.currentPageIndex ||
      newVal.currentPageSize !== oldVal.currentPageSize
    ) {
      this.tableCore.setOptions('pageCount', newVal.pageCount);
      this.manualPaginationOptions = { ...newVal };
    }
  }`

Also, there is an issue with manual pagination. It's not showing the right data range for the current page index.

![image](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/48927186/0e1a3b38-3854-44f2-9e41-4562f6bb0d3d)

title: Modus Select - Different behavior between optimized and unoptimized code
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

We found an issue with the Modus Select. It behaves differently between optimized code and unoptimized code and because of that the logic written for default value and onValueChanged differs.
Below it's a picture on how a list looks like in 2 different environments one optimize and one not:

![modus_select_bug](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/98012598/e3ad79d5-05f4-4a24-a22b-74a2c2388efe)

I noticed the issue also in the docs https://modus-web-components.trimble.com/?path=/docs/user-inputs-select--default 
In the official docs you have e.details as the result value of an value change - which happened for us in optimized code
and in the canvas, the result is actually e.detail.display, what we saw in unoptimized code

![Untitled](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/98012598/cf55c473-4c0e-480e-9476-dd2d9227e4ba)

description:

### Proposal

The Materia team would like to be able to paste large amounts of data into a modus table.

This includes:
- Pasting into a single row.
- Pasting into a single column.
- Pasting into multiple rows and columns

For this to work you'd need to be able to select all of the cells in a table and paste into them. You'd also need to be able to select an entire row or an entire column.

### Motivation and context

Pasting list of data that represent points in 3D space would make the Materia graph app very powerful.

title: Default icon color inconsistencies
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

There are some inconsistencies in the default icon colors that have made it harder to keep behavior consistent across all icons.
The inconsistencies are:
1. Which elements the fill color property values are set on. Some set the fill on the `svg`, and others on the `path` elements.
2. Which colors are used as the default values for those properties. Some use `'currentColor'`, others use `#6A6976` or `#252a2e`

To resolve these issue and improve icon consistency, I suggest a few changes:
1. Use the `fill` property on the `svg` elements inside of the icon components, rather than the `path` elements
2. Default the `fill` property value to `'currentColor'` - which means that the fill color of that path will be the same as the color property of the element or its parent element (see example: https://jsfiddle.net/s4c1e2nu/1/)
3. Use a constant value for the icon default size of `16`

description:

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

The Failed Avatar example is not using a valid URL. The URL must begin with `https://`. This isn't a Modus Web Components issue, if the component is used as intended any valid URL which fails to load will display correctly but simply having the URL as 'broken-link' is not valid.

I suggest changing those URLs to something like: `https://avatar.example.com/broken-image-link.png`.
