title: Allow tabs to be set using slots
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [Modus style guidelines](https://modus.trimble.com/components/web/introduction/)

### Proposal

Currently using the tabs component is done so by providing an object list of the tabs to add. This poses an issue for us when supplying translation strings in angular, since the html template is responsible for translating; I imagine this is a more general issue with translations that isn't specific to angular.

I'm proposing altering the way tabs work to use slotted content for each tab (a good example of this can be found [here](https://shoelace.style/components/tab-group)). This makes it much easier for an implementer to use the tabs component.

Additionally, tab components tend to include slots for the content to display when each tab is active. This is less of a requirement and more of a nice to have if possible.

### Motivation and context

Providing component layout via an object rather that through slotted/projected content is not a developer friendly way of doing things. It also requires that the implementer looks after the state of the current active tab in order to render content relating to the tab. This is something the Modus component could do for us.

### What is the issue regarding ?

@trimble-oss/modus-web-components, @trimble-oss/modus-angular-components

### Priority

Low

### What product/project are you using Modus Components for ?

Predesign, AddLocation, Spaces

Habitat/SketchUp

Yes

title: Modus Table - column reorder is not working properly
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

Column reorder is not working properly when we drag and drop the column to an specific place,
it always go to the last column.

- when we're creating a table and set the column 
ex:
 `modusTable.columns = [ { id: 'first-name' } ];`

it's generating a dynamic ID to identify the table (in cases that we're creating more than one table)

this dynamic ID is going to be placed in the DOM element 

ex 
`<th id="asdfsd3er2ertgdfer_first-name">`

so when we're dragging and dropping, it's trying to find `first-name` but it can't find the element with the generated ID and that's why is putting the column at the end.

This changes is to update the `columns` and `columnReorder` in the tableOptions to set the properly ID and fix the reorder behavior

[screen-capture.webm](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/141681143/84069e18-e9cf-4b71-9fe1-bfb7540aa02b)

title: Add all modus icons
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [Modus style guidelines](https://modus.trimble.com/components/web/introduction/)

### Proposal

The modus icon set includes hundreds of icons out of the box, however it looks like the vast majority of them are not available in modus web components. Whilst I understand that people have requested icons on a case-by-case basis, it doesn't make sense to me that these are added ad-hoc. In my opinion, if Modus WCs support modus icons, then all icons should be available for use. 

I can see in the source code that you are using the svg's directly and have individual components for each, which probably explains why all the icons have not yet been implemented, however an alternative approach might be to use the modus icons font as this would support all icons out of the box and any future changes to modus icons would be very easy to update to.

### Motivation and context

A lot of the icons we use in our products are not currently in Modus WCs. We are currently starting work to transition from our own Modus-based UI library to using Modus WCs

### What is the issue regarding ?

@trimble-oss/modus-web-components

Low

title: Document the different ways to subscribe to NPM releases
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [Modus style guidelines](https://modus.trimble.com/components/web/introduction/)

### Proposal

From @coliff,

- **RSS**: The https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/releases page has an RSS feed. If you use an RSS feed reader enter the URL and you'll get notified on each new release. I do this personally for some packages

- **GitHub Notifications**: There is a 'Watch' dropdown on the repo page https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components and you can choose to get notifications on new releases from there. You can set up notifications for these. I use the browser extension which works really well: https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/notifier-for-github/lmjdlojahmbbcodnpecnjnmlddbkjhnn

- **Dependabot for GitHub**: If you use GitHub to host your code you can set up dependabot to automatically create a PR for new dependencies. It's very configurable - you can choose how often to check (daily, weekly or monthly). We use this on all the Modus projects and it can be integrated with CI/CD so you can get a deploy preview with each dependency update. https://docs.github.com/en/code-security/dependabot/dependabot-version-updates/configuring-dependabot-version-updates

- **Node Check Updates**: You can add a script to your package.json and name it something like 'check-updates' and enter the script: npx npm-check-updates. It'll check for updates and report which ones are available. You can even configure it to automatically update dependencies if you want and exclude others. I use this regularly and recommend it. Read more about it at: https://www.npmjs.com/package/npm-check-updates

### Motivation and context

We can have this added to contributing file or the readme file or storybook page. 

### What is the issue regarding ?

@trimble-oss/modus-web-components, Modus Web Components Website (Storybook)

title: Modus Web Components - Add details about what goes inside default `slot`s
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [Modus style guidelines](https://modus.trimble.com/components/web/introduction/)

### Proposal
Slots allow users to add any content to a Web component.


For Example, In the Modus List Item, users can add any content using the default `slot`. However, we can provide more detailed information about what type of content is allowed and what is not recommended to ensure that users stay within the Modus guidelines. This will help users understand the boundaries of the Modus List Item and prevent them from deviating from the recommended usage. Another example is content tree.
![image](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/50131391/5868b593-b6b1-461f-a38a-e9448ecb43b3)

Identify components with a generic `slot`.

### Motivation and context

From a conversation with E-Builder team on adding a custom content to the Content tree items

title: Open calendar on available dates when the input date is completely outside the min/max range
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [Modus style guidelines](https://modus.trimble.com/components/web/introduction/)

### Proposal

If the date input is being used with a picker and min and max properties have been set to the input and the user typed a date to the input that is out of the min-max range then when the user clicks on the calendar icon then open a calendar widget on the month that has available dates and is closer to the min-max date.

When the selected date is before the min-max range - then open a calendar on the min date.
When the selected date is after the min-max range - then open a calendar on the max date.

Current result:

- Properties set:

![image](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/35339097/11a3c8fa-1129-4686-9e2d-a7724e1c44c9)


Date input and what the calendar shows to the user: No date is available.

![image](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/35339097/aaf20867-0b49-40f1-9c33-1c93079a7c79)


All available dates are in the previous month so it should be shown by default:

![image](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/35339097/73aa4d4a-5348-40c8-848d-8dd8a54d1dfb)

title: Modus-Modal | Tooltip for a disabled primary button
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [Modus style guidelines](https://modus.trimble.com/components/web/introduction/)

### Proposal

We should be able to give the reason why the primary button is disabled so that users can take action to enable the button.

The tooltip doesn't have to be visible when the button isn't disabled, I just need to be able to control it at the same time the button is disableddisable the button

Here's a link to the figma for the change, note the tool tip present above the button labeled "yes, update retainage"
![image](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/109538462/95c080e6-24bb-44ec-8545-c472db51d32e)


### Motivation and context

We need to maintain a high level of accessibility in our product. If someone was using a screen reader to aid them in completing this work they may have trouble figuring out how to enable the button that is disabled.

Here are the design requirements written by UX for the ticket I'm working on. It should provide some specific implementation details and other guidelines and context
```
 Design


The accessible name of a tooltip can come from the contents, or from an aria-label or aria-labelledby.

position: top

text: “You must enter a percent to continue.”

aria-label: “You must enter a percent to continue.”

The tooltip should appear on focus or when the element is hovered on after a 2 second delay.

It displays and disappears via keyboard focus and removal of focus and by the mouse events - mousing over and mousing out.

The tooltip never receives focus. Focus stays on the owning element.

Escape key closes it if its open

The element that serves as the tooltip container has role="tooltip" set.

The element that triggers the tooltip references the tooltip element with aria-describedby and references the ID of the container with the tooltip text
```

### What is the issue regarding ?

@trimble-oss/modus-web-components

Medium

Toast should be dismissed after some configurable time. 

### Motivation and context

**Case :** 
If user is doing multiple actions on single page, we will notify toast for every actions. we don't want our user to close this toast everytime.


**Our case :** 
please go through the image,
In our case, we will list number of users in this page, he might click resend button for some users, for every clicks, we will send out an invitation in the background and notify by toast.

title: Date Picker state setDate method is not ISO 8601 compliant
description:

- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

Month and date values less than 10 are not left padded with zero, resulting in a non compliant ISO 8601 date format. 

This causes unexpected behavior when constructing a date from the element value, for example '2023-1-1'.

title: Request for third button in modal window
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [Modus style guidelines](https://modus.trimble.com/components/web/introduction/)

### Proposal

The current modus to two buttons options primary and secondary. For our use case we need three buttons  'Close', 'Watch later' and 'Request quote'.


Attaching the mockup screenshot
![image](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/145763175/3a0f7c8e-13b4-4985-9be2-42f5129385d3)


### Motivation and context

The requirement is to show a banner/video. The user is given three options to select 'Close', 'Watch later' and 'Request quote'.
Close : To closes the dialog and user will not be shown this popup again (this means that user does not want to see this popup again).
Watch later :  The user does not want to see it now but would like to see after some time. 
Request quote : The user has seen the video and wants us to connect the team. 

checkbox : To get the user consent.



### What is the issue regarding ?

@trimble-oss/modus-web-components,@trimble-oss/modus-angular-components

High, Medium

Transporeon TPW home page

title: Content Tree: Event handling for Ctrl+Click and Shift+ArrowKeys
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [Modus style guidelines](https://modus.trimble.com/components/web/introduction/)

### Proposal

Currently the ContentTreeItem component handles the ItemClick event. We'd also like similar event handling for cases involving Ctrl+Click and Shift+ArrowKeys or a single event handler for when the selection is changed.

### Motivation and context

In Creator we use the Content Tree to reflect the structure of the 3D object hiearachy in the in the viewer. Whenever we select an item in the ContentTree the same 3D object needs to be (de)selected. Single selection can be handled though the ItemClick event, but this does not handle cases where Ctrl+Click and Shift+ArrowKeys is used to select an item.
![chrome_qqbmxBgSeT](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/99886588/dfb488f5-45bd-4bbb-85a2-7d6e7650f9a3)

title: Update Modus date picker to accept inputs in different formats
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [Modus style guidelines](https://modus.trimble.com/components/web/introduction/)

### Proposal

Update Modus date picker to accept inputs in different formats:

1. input with 2 digit year:   01.02.20 = view: Jan 2, 2020 
2. input with alpha, no symbols:   Jan 02 2020 = view: Jan 2, 2020
3. input with dash/dot/slash separators: 01-02-2020, 01.02.20, 01/02/2020 = view: Jan 2, 2020
4. input full month alpha: January 2, 2020 = view: Jan 2, 2020

All Inputs should be properly converted to the correct format specified on the “format“ attribute.

description:

title: Modus Table - Tanstack library - nested row selection issue
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [Modus style guidelines](https://modus.trimble.com/components/web/introduction/)

### Proposal

The state logic of `Modus Table` is managed with the help of [Tanstack](https://tanstack.com/table/v8). There is a known [issue ](https://github.com/TanStack/table/issues/4938) with row selection in Tanstack where if a table has double (or more) nesting, and a child is selected, its direct parent can use getIsSomeSelected() to toggle its indeterminate selection state. However, its grandparent cannot do so as it only checks the first level of its children.

### Motivation and context
https://github.com/TanStack/table/issues/4938

@trimble-oss/modus-web-components

title: Issue with Manual Entry of Dates in Date Picker Field
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

I'd like to bring attention to a specific issue related to manually entering dates in the date picker field, rather than selecting them from the calendar. In such cases, I've observed the following problems:

**Incorrect Handling of Invalid Dates:** When entering an invalid date like "31-09-2023," the calendar interprets it as "01-09-2023." This behaviour is inaccurate, and it would be more appropriate to implement validation that highlights or notifies users about such errors.

**Handling of Invalid Dates like 30-02-2023:** Similarly, when inputting an invalid date like "30-02-2023," the calendar interprets it as "02-03-2023." and it would be beneficial to implement validation that either highlights the error or prevents the entry of such invalid dates during manual input.

I believe addressing these issues would improve the accuracy and reliability of the date picker's manual input functionality. Thank you for your attention to this matter.

### Reduced test cases

Linux

When trying to view a kebab menu within an accordion it is not possible to display the menu option items,

title: Select component using display as the component's value rather than the object passed in
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

The Select component should only use the `optionsDisplayProp` for displaying the text value in the select. Selection and the current value should depend on whatever object/value is currently selected:

```tsx
const options = [{ id: 0, display: 'Option1' }, { id: 1, display: 'Option2' }];
<Select options={options} value={options[0]} options-display-prop="display" />

// *click Option2*
// valueChange output:
// CURRENTLY: 'Option2'
// SHOULD: { id: 1, display: 'Option2' }
```

### Reduced test cases

Make sure valueChange is the object rather than the display prop

### What operating system(s) are you seeing the problem on?

Windows

description:

### Proposal

Request from @davidtsilcock 

RE: Slider - https://modus-web-components.trimble.com/?path=/docs/components-slider--default

It'd be good if the range slider supported adding a `name`, `id` and `list` property as well as a linked `datalist`.

See MDN for an example: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input/range#adding_tick_marks

The main use case for Creator is for parameters for use in the Parameter panel and live components.

description:

### Describe the issue

Error:
`Cannot find module '@trimble-oss/modus-web-components' or its corresponding type declarations.`

See logs here:
https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/actions/workflows/publish-angular.yml

I don't know how to fix right now, but something to do with relative paths or something?
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/37548734/tsc-throws-ts2307-cannot-find-module-for-a-local-file

For now we need to publish manually via the CLI until this is fixed.

description:

### Describe the issue

Modus Table - Controls not syncing immediately 

Tested on PR - https://deploy-preview-1576--modus-webcomponents.netlify.app/

Pagination: In the controls section if Pagination control is set to "True", the changed is not applied immediately. Only after the web page is refreshed changes is reflected

Rows-expandable: In the controls section if Rows-expandable control is set to "False", the changes is not applied immediately. Only after the web page is refreshed the changes is reflected

title: [BUG] Modus Table - Column Visibility - Top panel - If any changes is made and user click on Cancel button, when user reopen the panel, selection or changes that was cancelled is displayed and it is not reset to the current selection of column visibility options
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

Modus Table - Column Visibility - Top panel - If any changes is made and user click on Cancel button, without applying changes the panel is closed. When the user reopen the panel again,  previous selections (Selection that was cancelled) is displayed and it is not reset to the current selections of column visibility options

**Expected Result:** When the panel is reopened it should reset and display current selections of column visibility options

Tested on PR: https://deploy-preview-1576--modus-webcomponents.netlify.app/

Please refer the below GIF:
![2023-07-26_21h28_28](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/129380495/9dc3f7a6-acdf-43de-99a8-b1dbdee611f8)

title: Modus components inside an angular web app is too small
description:
### Describe the issue

Hi guys,

I was trying to test this modus web components design framework and checking the compatibility within some of our software products. For my case, I am using this on Angular 15 (and would go for Angular 16 soon)

The components are working but it seems that it was too zoomed out (or too small) for a reason. check below.

![image](https://github.com/trimble-oss/website-modus.trimble.com/assets/1312938/0edcf05d-d255-418f-bacd-86908ff6cda5)

is there a way to override some of the css classes here? I have seen that the `#shadow-root` stops me to do some things.

![image](https://github.com/trimble-oss/website-modus.trimble.com/assets/1312938/a3976272-6616-46e3-8515-57deb99f5cd8)

Thanks

PS.
I have also added `size=large` seems too small. (has computed height size of `30px`) 

![image](https://github.com/trimble-oss/website-modus.trimble.com/assets/1312938/ede3ef7c-c94f-4b9b-8379-0c45079a40c1)

title: Deprecate / Unlist old versions with known issues
description:
I think we should consider deprecating (unlist) old version with known issues:

https://docs.npmjs.com/unpublishing-packages-from-the-registry#unpublishing-a-single-version-of-a-package

It's straight-forward to do via CLI and is reversible (if needed). I think it would help push users to update to a newer version.

- [x] [Angular Modus Components](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@trimble-oss/modus-angular-components?activeTab=versions)
- [x] [React Modus Components](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@trimble-oss/modus-react-components?activeTab=versions)
- [x] [Modus Web Components](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@trimble-oss/modus-web-components?activeTab=versions)

title: [BUG] Modus Table Component - Column Reorder/Visibility - editing panel Options after the first render not working
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

**Scenario 1:**
Modus Table Component - Column Reorder - Panel Options - If the panel options is added in controls and when tried to remove certain columns on top panel of the canvas section, "Apply" button does not update the changes

title: Modus Modal - backdrop (true, false, 'static') - not available
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [Modus style guidelines](https://modus.trimble.com/components/web/introduction/)

### Proposal

In the modus modal component a new property "backdrop" is required.
This would accept 3 values - true, false, "static"
When the backdrop is "static" - the modal does not close when we click outside the modal.
When the backdrop is false - the background of the modal is not an opaque screen, the background would be the same page, The modal would not also be closed once clicked outside the modal.
When the backdrop is true ( default mode ) - the backdrop is an opaque image, as usual and the modal would close once clicked outside the modal.

Below is the example for the expected way the backdrop="static" to work,
![backdrop-static](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/132334449/fa67d180-960e-41ce-b124-ad54944127cb)

Below is the example for the expected way the backdrop=false to work,
![backdrop-false](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/132334449/f1f34078-d59b-4c49-a626-3d3ec931c581)


Below is the example for the expected way the backdrop=true to work,
![backdrop-true](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/132334449/baf15faa-e3f0-4c4c-ab09-93ca800f1671)


### Motivation and context

We had a feature in our application where we make a background call on submitting the modal submit.
We then show the details from the response in the modal itself.
But while we progress the API-call in the background, if the user clicks anywhere outside the modal, the modal.close() is triggered and it gets closed.
Hence the process is interrupted.

### What is the issue regarding ?

@trimble-oss/modus-web-components

### Priority

High

### What product/project are you using Modus Components for ?

TGAP

### What is your team/division name ?

SPIME

### Are you willing to contribute ?

Yes

### Are you using Modus Web Components in production ?

Not yet.

description:

### Describe the issue

Modus Table - data disappears when ordering is reset to 'none'.

When using redux to store the state of the data that should be displayed in the table the following issue arises:

1. Change ordering of a column three times so it is reset to 'none'
2. On reset to 'none' the data inside the table disappears. Note: It is still part of the redux state



### Reduced test cases

title: [BUG] Modus Table - Column Reorder - Keyboard Navigation - User will have to resize the column using keyboard,  after resizing the column hit on enter key, column header is elevated to perform the reorder
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

Modus Table - Column Reorder - Keyboard Navigation - User will have to resize the column using keyboard,  after resizing the column hit on enter key, column header is elevated to perform the reorder

Tested on PR: https://deploy-preview-1485--modus-webcomponents.netlify.app/

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Access the above PR
2. Select Table - Column Reorder
3. Hit on Tab key to perform column resize
4. Once the column is resized (do not hit on escape or tab key)
5. Hit on Enter Key
6. Verify if the column header is elevated 

**Expected result:**  The Column header should not be elevated, column reorder action should not be performed

**Actual result:**  The Column header is elevated and user is allowed to perform the reordering action

![image](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/129380495/eeefb376-56d5-4080-b7d4-d64f57005eb6)

title: [BUG] Modus Table - When Full width is False - If age column is resized to minimum and using tab Age column should be selected, and when user hold enter key more than a second the column is moved beside next column
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

Table Component - When Full width is False - If age column is resized to minimum and using tab Age column should be selected, and when user hold enter key more than a second the column is moved beside next column

Tested with the PR# https://deploy-preview-1485--modus-webcomponents.netlify.app/

**Steps to Reproduce:**

1. Pre requisite: Full width should be False and Age column should be resized to minimum
2. When user hit on tab key and select Age column, the header should be highlighted
3. Hit on enter key
4. Header is elevated to reorder the column
5. Hit on Enter key for the second time or hold enter key for more than a second
6. The column is moved beside the next column

**Expected Result:** The elevated header should not move unless the user performs the action by left or right arrow keys

**Actual Result** Hitting the enter key twice or by holding enter key for more than a second the column is moved beside next column

Please refer the below screenshots:
![image](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/129380495/a27a5eef-c83a-462c-ac3e-55c977b1fceb)

![image](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/129380495/1df77ba4-5c05-4e0e-88e3-ba2464ac897f)

Modus Table - Column Resize - Keyboard navigation - Escape key functionality to be implemented

**Actual Result:** User will have to hit on tab key to proceed further

title: Modus Table - Column Reorder- Keyboard navigation - Escape key functionality to be implemented
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [Modus style guidelines](https://modus.trimble.com/components/web/introduction/)

### Proposal

Modus Table - Column Reorder- Keyboard navigation - Escape key functionality to be implemented

On mouse navigation - User will click on the header and start dragging to reorder and in between decides not to change the position of selected column he can go back to the existing place of the header and leave the mouse click. This will result in no changes
image

no change after the mouse is released on the same column header
![image](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/129380495/f8835c28-f5ca-4a05-b7c2-4a3cdc3b9c80)

In case of Keyboard navigation: When User Hit enter key, the column header can be moved further or beside any existing column. when tried to hit enter placing it on the same header or if user hit escape key there is no action performed. It just stays on the same place as shown in the screenshot:

It is expected to be released when user hit on escape key, as the user does not want to proceed with column reorder. As this is how it works with mouse navigation.
![image](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/129380495/ec3b580c-5895-4890-9df9-2921240b03b5)

title: Add React 18 Integration
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [Modus style guidelines](https://modus.trimble.com/components/web/introduction/)

### Proposal

This issue is proposing to follow the existing React 17 pattern, and create a new directory and workflow for publishing React 18 components.

Under the `./react-workspace` directory there will be a new react-18 lib which will publish using the existing semver pattern of:

<modus-web-components-version>-<react primary version>

1.0.45-18

### Motivation and context

Allows React 18 applications to use Modus Web Component integration without having to use the node --legacy-peer-deps flag when running npm install.

### What is the issue regarding ?

@trimble-oss/modus-web-components

title: Modus Tooltip - Integrate popper.js
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [Modus style guidelines](https://modus.trimble.com/components/web/introduction/)

### Proposal

We are encountering many [issues](https://github.com/orgs/trimble-oss/projects/5/views/2?filterQuery=-label%3Aepic+-status%3ADone++tooltip+repo%3A%22trimble-oss%2Fmodus-web-components%22+) with Modus Tooltip component, and we should consider using a 3rd party library like [popperjs](https://popper.js.org/) / [floating-ui](https://floating-ui.com/) which is already used in Modus Bootstrap, and it solves our problems with placement and overflow prevention.


Additional references:
[Tooltip issue.docx](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/files/11451548/Tooltip.issue.docx)


## Make sure other Tooltip issues(#1173, #1498, #1408, #958, #1391) which are linked with this are fixed.

### Describe the issue

User Input components - Dark theme - The background color for user input components is not as per style guide

The background color in dark theme for all user input components should be with color code `#171c1e`, however currently we see the background color in dark theme with color code `#252a2e`

Please refer below screenshot of the style guide
![image](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/129380495/9051df36-7aca-43d8-8bf2-db968f67a08c)

title: Floating Toolbar in Web Components
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [Modus style guidelines](https://modus.trimble.com/components/web/introduction/)

### Proposal

This is a ticket outlining the work to be done on the toolbar in the floating UI style that has been discussed with the modus team.

This development can be carried out by the Creator/Nexus team.

Original toolbar: 
Modus doesn't currently have a toolbar in its library, however, it would look something like this in the current style.
![Screenshot 2023-06-14 102701](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/106724479/2b5a5fb3-7062-4f32-843c-47f639193923)

Floating UI Navbar:
![Screenshot 2023-06-14 102715](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/106724479/32432f73-fdd3-43ad-8671-820593a8f15a)

Trimble Creator Navbar:
![Screenshot 2023-06-14 102304](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/106724479/513e622e-6cf1-43f5-9fa3-d966d9c30de4)

The toolbar would like just be a standard modus button contained in a panel/wrapper of some sort.

We would like to develop this as a Modus web component, and then contribute it back to Modus.

### Motivation and context

Floating UI is a critical part of a canvas-style application such as Trimble Creator, SketchUp, Maps, and more. This UI allows the user to focus more o the creative space rather than the encompassing UI.

### What is the issue regarding ?

@trimble-oss/modus-web-components

### Priority

Medium

### What product/project are you using Modus Components for ?

Trimble Creator

### What is your team/division name ?

Nexus

### Are you willing to contribute ?

Yes

### Are you using Modus Web Components in production ?

Not yet, this will be one of the first steps on our migration to web-components in Trimble Creator.

As part of e-Builder’s Navigation Project, we need a search overlay for the Modus Navbar component.

- The user clicks on the search icon, and then an overlay takes over the entire header
- All other elements are hidden, Including Logo and Profile.
- The search input field and the X (close) icon are displayed

title: Storybook .tsx are not being linted with ESLint
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have validated any HTML to avoid common problems
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

Running `npm run lint-js` from the stencil-workspace folder is not linting the .tsx files in the storybook folder despite the ESLint config including the [Storybook ESLint plugin ](https://storybook.js.org/blog/how-to-use-storybook-with-eslint/).

If we adjust the lint-js to this:

`eslint src/** storybook/**/*.stories.tsx --no-error-on-unmatched-pattern`

and then run the command it reports some minor issues - just Missing semicolon and Strings must use singlequote.

### Priority

High

title: Add Engines to specify minimum version of Node in Package.json (Angular Components)
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Proposal

I think we should add engines field to the Modus Angular Components package.json - like this:

```json
  "engines": {
    "node": ">=14.15.0"
  }
```

Angular v14.x requires at least NodeJS v14.15.0
https://angular.io/guide/versions#actively-supported-versions

### Motivation and context

Adding this will warn any users attempting to install Modus Angular Components if they have an old, incompatible version of NodeJS.

### Which npm package?

@trimble-oss/modus-angular-components

Medium

title: Update Prettier Config
description:
- The default prettier config sets: `"printWidth": 80,` by default which is too narrow. Suggest we change it to 125. 
- Currently the `npm run prettier` command in storybook dir only runs on `storybook/stories/` - we should also run it on the `src/` dir
- We can update Prettier dev dep from v2.8.7 to v2.8.8 too

Config would be:

```json
{
  "bracketSameLine": true,
  "printWidth": 125,
  "singleQuote": true
}
```

cc @ryan-henness-trimble @msankaran0712

title: Create a MWC Update Guide
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Proposal

Now that the library is mature enough to start introducing breaking changes, we should discuss how we want to help consumers update their usages when breaking changes occur

I see 3 options:
1. A markdown file called `UPDATE_GUIDE.md` at the repository root
2. A page in the Storybook site
3. An interactive site that let's the user pick which version they are starting with and which version they are updating to. That would then generate all the necessary steps they would take to update. This is a larger effort, and possibly overkill for the speed of development of this project

Either way, I think these options would all contain the same information: a descriptive list of what has been removed/deprecated and how to resolve issues that arise while updating from one version to the next

### Motivation and context

_No response_

@trimble-oss/modus-web-components

Low

title: Chip close icon and height
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Proposal

Modus Chip close icon uses `icon-remove` which is different from the icon described in Modus Style Guide (https://modus.trimble.com/components/web/chips/styles/). That one is `icon-close`. A possible solution is to add a new optional property where the consumer can decide which they want to use. Possible name: `closeIcon`.
Also, the chip height is different when the icons are visible 
![image](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/48927186/a3a9db45-f4c4-4796-af3e-0a0d127872db)
The padding-top and padding-bottom are 0 if there is no icon. 
`&.no-left-icon.no-right-icon {
    padding: 0 $rem-16px;
  }`
It should be the same always
`padding: $rem-2px $rem-4px;`

### Motivation and context

_No response_

@trimble-oss/modus-web-components

Medium

### Proposal

We should create a `CONSIDERATIONS.md` document to assist developers while they are contributing or reviewing changes in the Modus Web Components library.

### Motivation and context

This document's goal would be to help developers get their head back in the context of MWC quicker, making it easier for them to contribute and review changes to the library. This could also serve as a "repository" of things that we want to improve on in future changes.

title: TP-6913: modus-modal should have option to disable primary-button and secondary-button
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

[BUG] Autocomplete Web component - Keyboard accessibility - When the user hit on up and down arrow keys on the keyboard, dropdown list items is not selected

**Steps to reproduce the behavior on Canvas section:**

1. Go to Autocomplete web component
2. Click on Canvas section
3. Hit on tab key on the keyboard
4. Autocomplete search textbox should be selected
5. Enter letter A in the textbox
6. Dropdown list should be displayed
7. Hit on Up and Down arrow keys to select the drop down list items
8. Dropdown list items is not selected accordingly

The first item in the dropdown list should be preselected and when user hit on up and down arrow keys on the keyboard, the list of items on the dropdown should be selected accordingly

title: Autocomplete - Controls - The behavior of Read-only functionality is not as expected
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have validated any HTML to avoid common problems
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

Autocomplete - Controls - The behavior of Read-only functionality is not as expected

When the auto search field is set to Read-only, we expect the text field to be disabled where the user should not be able to enter any text in the text box and the field should only be focused when the user selects the text field.

Currently, the textbox is active and also user is able to type in search box. After entering the data user will have to give a space and "No results found" text is displayed as shown in the below screenshot:
![image](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/129380495/5727fbfc-bce0-4922-a2fe-396b868655ca)

**Steps to reproduce:**

1. Access the storybook
2. Select Autocomplete web component Default/With Option/With Custom Option
3. On the canvas section, under Controls set 'Read-only' status to 'True'
4. Place the cursor on the Search textbox
5. Enter the required data and give a space

**Expected Behavior:** When the auto search field is set Read only we expect the text field to be disabled where the user should not be able to enter any text in the text box and the field should only be focused when the user selects the text field.

**Current Behavior:** The textbox is active and also user is able to type in search box. After entering the data user will have to give a space and "No results found" text is displayed.


### Reduced test cases

_No response_

Windows

description:

- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Proposal

Allow for the user icon to have its border and initial background color to be configurable. 

Presently, the avatar image / initials span are given borders when active, focused, and hovered.  This proposal is to allow for a border color to exist when not interacted with.  Presently, we cannot control whether the border is showing, nor what color it is.  The implementation details are TBD.

As part of e-Builder's user delegation feature, we are looking to indicate when the user is acting on behalf of another user by adding a border around their avatar/initials.

description:

- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Proposal

We were given the following UX, shown below. We will ensure alignment with Modus Design System and Modus Web Components teams before starting work

The scope of this change would be to add a `slot` under the profile menu links.  We will use that for user delegation within e-Builder, but would leave this area generic to allow it to be flexible.

![image](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/1130129/18fbb1c5-2bf7-49a2-8c44-6e1e4bd87875)

**Tasks**
1. Add `slot` area to User Profile Menu
2. Handle styling when there is and isn't content to be added.

It is e-Builder's intent to work on this request.

### Motivation and context

We have a user delegation feature in e-Builder which allows a user to work on behalf of another individual. In order to maintain that feature and use the Modus NavBar, we require an area enable user context switching.  By making it a slot, we enable reusability and flexibility with its use.

title: Modus NavBar - Logo Is Responsive
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Proposal

Toggle the product logo with a smaller icon variant at the `Small` breakpoint of 576px for responsiveness.

We do one of the following:
1. Add a property to `productLogoOptions` for `smallUrl` (or `iconUrl` though icon may be confusing).
2. Redefine the interface for `productLogoOptions` with a property for `logo` and one for `icon` which can each then have a `height` and `url` property.
3.  Rename `url` to `logoUrl` and add `iconUrl`.  We could have `url` as deprecated, and overridden with `logoUrl` to phase it in.

Then we would add `@media (min-width: 576px)` as needed to show one image or the other as is currently done with the bootstrap implementation.

Example change
![image](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/1130129/bc4d0d37-d9cb-42ff-8e3f-8b3758719610)
![image](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/1130129/481e6245-51a7-48d1-bf3b-6cfde61a7c2f)

This is small portion of #89, creating a new issue as we wish to split up that effort.

It is e-Builder's intent to work on this request.

### Motivation and context

Implement missing aspect of modus spec per our UX direction.

### Which npm package?

@trimble-oss/modus-web-components

### Priority

Medium

### What is the product name the feature is requested for?

e-Builder

### What is the team name the product belongs to?

e-Builder

title: Modus Table - Enable Scrolling - Spike
description:
Explore the challenges in displaying a horizontal and vertical scroll bar for Modus DataTable.

Known issue:
HTML `<table>` display a vertical scroll bar for the whole table including column headers and it might not be a preferable option for some products.

Example, 
![Image](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/50131391/d9c18fdc-e4f4-4b1c-b4bb-1e5e6444c110)




Todo:
1. Explore options for displaying a vertical scroll bar only for the body section and make sure there is no side-effect
2. If we identify Table cannot achieve the above functionality, must decide whether we need to migrate from table tags to divs, ex: ag-grid.
3. Explore if there is any challenge in the horizontal scroll bar 
4. Create an issue for the actual implementation


### Motivation and context

title: Generate html.customData JSON file for VS Code autocomplete
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Proposal

Stencil supports outputting the components as a `vscode-data.json` file which can be used in VS Code to autocomplete all the Modus Web Component element names and properties.
https://stenciljs.com/docs/docs-vscode

It's an awesome feature and will give developers a big productivity boost as it includes documentation (on hover). The popular Shoelace Web Component library includes it in their npm package so all developers can add it to their `.vscode/settings.json`.
https://shoelace.style/getting-started/usage?id=code-completion

It should be quite easy for us to add this by adding the output option to `stencil.config.ts` and making sure the generated JSON is included in the npm package. Then we just need to update the README and website to let people know.

### Motivation and context

This will be a great productivity boost for developers using VS Code... and the file will automatically update with each release.

### Which npm package?

@trimble-oss/modus-web-components

Medium

Modus

title: [BUG] Dropdown - Keyboard accessibility - When the user hit on up and down arrow keys on the keyboard, dropdown list items is not selected
description:
[BUG] Dropdown Web component - Keyboard accessibility - When the user hit on up and down arrow keys on the keyboard, dropdown list items is not selected

Steps to reproduce the behavior on Docs section:

1. Go to Dropdown web component
2. Click on Docs section
3. Scroll down to Dropdown Element
4. Hit on <kbd>Tab</kbd> key on the keyboard
5. Dropdown element should be selected
6. Hit on <kbd>Enter</kbd> key on the keyboard
7. Dropdown list should be displayed
8. Hit on <kbd>Up</kbd> and <kbd>Down</kbd> arrow keys to select the drop down list items
9. Dropdown list items is not selected accordingly

Steps to reproduce the behavior on Canvas section:

1. Go to Dropdown web component
2. Click on Canvas section
3. Hit on <kbd>Tab</kbd> key on the keyboard
4. Dropdown element should be selected
5. Hit on <kbd>Enter</kbd> key on the keyboard
6. Dropdown list should be displayed
7. Hit on <kbd>Up</kbd> and <kbd>Down</kbd> arrow keys to select the drop down list items
8. Dropdown list items is not selected accordingly

**Expected behavior**
The first item in the dropdown list should be preselected and when user hit on <kbd>up</kbd> and <kbd>down</kbd> arrow keys on the keyboard, the list of items on the dropdown should be selected accordingly

**Current behavior**
The list of items is not selected when the user hit on <kbd>up</kbd> and <kbd>down</kbd> arrow keys on the keyboard

Please refer the below screenshots:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/129380495/232822339-f570782f-f83f-423a-9e08-f5df747d17dc.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/129380495/232821811-645f697b-f307-4cc3-8ad7-f36ed6c69096.png)

- Browser Tested - Edge, Chrome and Firefox

title: [BUG] Color Scheme is always on light mode
description:
**Describe the bug**

Noticed a bug on [modus-web-components.trimble.com](https://modus-web-components.trimble.com/?path=/docs/introduction-getting-started--page). The [color-scheme CSS](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color-scheme) is always on lightmode. it's not a major problem, it just means some OS level controls like the scrollbar and autocomplete input form fields are always light.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Go to 'https://modus-web-components.trimble.com/?path=/docs/introduction-getting-started--page' when browser set to dark mode
2. Notice the left scrollbar is light gray and not dark gray as expected.

**Screenshots**

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1212885/231117981-c6ec7b1c-d6bf-4296-b3d2-e24f22ae3b29.png)

I think we need something like:

```css
body.dark {
  color-scheme: dark;
}
```

title: Modus Side Navigation - Export `ModusSideNavigationItemInfo` interface
description:
**Describe the bug**

[BUG] Modal Component closes on dragging off the modal
description:
**Describe the bug**
The modal component will close itself if the user starts a click on the modal body, then releases the click off of the modal body anywhere in the gray overlay area.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Open the modal component
2. Hold the mouse down with the mouse over the modal body
3. Move the mouse off the modal body and over the gray overlay area
4. Release the mouse button on the gray area
5. See that the modal closes

**Expected behavior**
It seems like the modal shouldn't close if a click starts on the modal body, or if the user is dragging on the modal body and releases their drag off the modal body.

title: Set up a Development Website which auto-builds deploys from `main`?
description:
On the new [Modus Icons website](http://modus-icons.trimble.com/) we have it setup to deploy to production on each new release.

We also have [a completely separate Azure SWA site](https://ambitious-sky-021d71010.2.azurestaticapps.net/) setup which does deploy previews and auto-builds from the main branch. It was straight-forward to setup and is good because it means recently added icons don't show on the production site until a release has shipped (which may only be once a month).

Do you think it might be useful for a similar setup for Modus Web Components? Maybe, as releases are made very frequently it may not be needed? What do you think?

title: Chip component enhancements
description: **Describe the solution you'd like** We would like to do these things in Modus Chips (See image below): - Change the background color. - Add a different icon at the left (other than the checkmark) - Format the value, maybe be able to use HTML. For example, changing the weight of part of the text. - Add a badge component at the right. **Describe alternatives you've considered** Modus buttons allow the last three points but we will need to change the border-radius to make the button looks like a chip. See image below. **Additional context**

description:

Install @trimble-oss/modus-web-components version 0.1.34 and use the modus-alert component
When the modal is opened the background will default to a "black" color.

- Browser: Chrome

Use Case:
This field can be used for description fields or fields that may need a paragraph worth of data.

title: Add Blue Navbar Option to Web Components
description:
Currently, only the white version of the navbar is available. 

- When we add the dark blue version, we need to revisit hover and active states for icon buttons. Current do not meet color contrast ratios, but more importantly, they are just plain difficult to see.

title: Remove Navigating through Content Tree by Tabbing
description:
Tabbing should take the user out of the tree into the main content area. Arrows enable the user to navigate through the tree. 

This is because we need a way for the user to skip the tree and go straight to the content. Tabbing through the entire tree could be really frustrating. 

- [x] Decide how to handle checkbox selection when tabbing is disabled

title: Input and Button group  in Web Components
description:

- Having an interactive search button inside the field. It means we don't need to add an extra button outside of the field to search. It just looks a lot cleaner in my opinion.
- Just added the option to have a button on the right of the inside field
- Adding a 24px x 24px button to the write of a text input field.
- Has a hover and pressed state. When clicked it will (in my case) perform the search.

title: RTF Editor Text Area in Web Components - Barebones
description:
### IMPORTANT: This should be broken down into smaller issues.

As a user I want to add rich text formatting to the text I input
- Desktop. A user wants to use bold style on parts of the the text in an announcement that shows in the homepage. They want links to have shorter user-friendly text and a bullet list.
- Rich text format (RTF) input
- Textarea input with styling toolbar.
- Rich text formatting allows the user to style the text by choosing the font weight, font type, font family and the font size. The user can also insert links into the textarea with a user-defined link text.

The user needs to format text, such as:
 - Font family, size, style and weight
 - Text alignment
 - Bullet lists and numbered lists
 - Add/edit links with link text
 
The user does not **need** to format text



![Image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/97305117/221238818-19885c54-22d1-4fc7-8021-b3c9dfb1ed6f.png)




Figma File: https://www.figma.com/file/wyfVJUHWRMkeCfdB38HFEE/Modus---Web?type=design&node-id=16926-43994&mode=design&t=iWrmgODEaqk0fc8q-0

The Close button should have attributes role="button" and aria-label="Close"

title: Incorrect progress bar outline / alerts / active chip / badges states on Web Components
description:
See details https://github.com/trimble-oss/website-modus.trimble.com/issues/394

from the above link:

Progress bar:

- [x] Light and dark Mode Progress bar:  outline is Gray (`#6a6e79`) 6 both in Figma and XD, but indicates a non-palette color on style guide "border: 1px solid `#8c8b96`"

Alerts:

- [x] Dark mode dark Alert outline should be changed from Gray 10 to Gray 8 `#464B52`
- [x] The frame color of the secondary Alert is inconsistent. Should be Gray 6.

Chips:

- [x] Dark mode active Chip/solid should be Trimble Dark Mode Blue `#019AEB`, it is currently Trimble blue on Style Guide. Both Figma and XD is `#019AEB`

Badges:

- [x] Light mode badges - warning badges have incorrect yellow on Style Guide. Currently on Yellow Dark. Both Figma and XD have correct Trimble Yellow `#FBAD26` with Trimble Gray label `#252A2E`
- [x] Dark mode - Dark badge label to be renamed to High Contrast

When opening a modus dropdown, and then attempting to open another dropdown. When the new dropdown opens, the previous dropdown is still active and showing. 

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Setup a page with two modus dropdowns. 
2. Click on one to 'open' the dropdown. 
3. Click on another dropdown. 
4. See that both dropdowns are open at the same time, sometimes overlapping the other. 

**Expected behavior**
Opening a dropdown should also clear other dropdowns of any active state. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/89219400/210408932-10f154d0-73a9-4fd4-8435-f7e5b368d59c.png)

title: Add Open Source Security Foundation Scorecard
description:
This enables the OpenSSF Scorecard GitHub Action to help us ensure the project will continue to follow the open-source best practices or even improve any possible practice to avoid security risks and vulnerabilities.

`Scorecards.yml` file enables the Scorecard action to run on push to main and once a week (important for some checks like contribution check)

REF: https://securityscorecards.dev/

```yml
name: Scorecards supply-chain security

on:
  # Only the default branch is supported.
  branch_protection_rule:
  push:
    branches:
      - main
  schedule:
    - cron: "16 10 * * 6"
  workflow_dispatch:

permissions: read-all

jobs:
  analysis:
    name: Scorecards analysis
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    permissions:
      security-events: write
      id-token: write
      contents: read
      actions: read

    steps:
      - name: Clone repository
        uses: actions/checkout@v3
        with:
          persist-credentials: false

      - name: Run analysis
        uses: ossf/scorecard-action@v2
        with:
          results_file: results.sarif
          results_format: sarif
          publish_results: true

      - name: Upload artifact
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v3
        with:
          name: SARIF file
          path: results.sarif
          retention-days: 5

      - name: Upload to code-scanning
        uses: github/codeql-action/upload-sarif@v1
        with:
          sarif_file: results.sarif
```

title: Dark Mode - Modus root variables
description:
Add the root color variables to the `modus-colors.scss`. 

Eventually these variables will replace the colors we currently have in the stylesheet. We should not remove the current variables until they are no longer in use - when adding these new root colors, we should prepend or append them with text that indicates that they are the new values. Once we've got all of our component switched over to these new root values, we can remove the old ones and get rid of the prepended/appended text on the variable names

title: Dark Mode for Web Components
description:
### Theme Setting

Implement 'dark' and 'light' theme setting for the web components
*Maybe* add a 'preference' mode which will automatically apply the user's preferred theme? This could be its own story outside of the Barebones requirements

There should be two ways to set the theme:
- [x] Page Level - Set the theme on the page's body with a class that the components can read from. This would apply the theme globally
- [x] Component Level - Set the theme directly on the component with a CSS attribute, which would override the Page Level setter

---

### 

- [x] #787
- [x] #788 
- [x] #789 
- [x] #796
- [x] #797
- [x] #800
- [x] #801
- [x] #802
- [x] #803
- [x] #804
- [x] #805
- [x] #843
- [x] #853
- [x] #874

Once we've got our pattern for setting the theme on the Page Level, a `ThemeToggle` component should be created that will switch the theme globally. This will allow consumers of the library to get 'out of the box' theme toggling

Old Note:
The Modus Data Table should have higher performance for large data sets. Testing with ~>5k rows, the table gets laggy

title: [BUG] Text inputs clear input accessibility issues
description:
https://modus-web-components.trimble.com/?path=/docs/user-inputs-text-input--default
Clear button on text inputs (the x icon on the right side when there is input) has a few a11y issues:

- button is not tall enough for a tap target. We should add CSS `min-height: 1.5rem;`
- button is currently actually just a span with no semantic markup. We should add `role="button"`
- There isn't an aria-label to describe what the button does. We should add `aria-label="Clear entry"`

(inspiration and research: https://scottaohara.github.io/clear-text-field-button/)

title: Add value accessor configs for form control inputs
description:
**Describe the solution you'd like**
The modus-angular-components package incorporates support for Reactive Forms usage.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Hand-coding the necessary wrappers to use Modus web components inside Reactive Forms. This is feasible but pushes the responsibility and ownership onto the consumer and would be burdensome and of limited benefit to enable sharing as it may only cover a subset of components.

**Additional context**
Stencil has an Angular Integration config option to generate the forms usage code

```ts
    angularOutputTarget({
      ...,
      valueAccessorConfigs: angularValueAccessorBindings,
    }),
```

Where `angularValueAccessorBindings` is an array of configurations for the components for which forms integration is required.

title: CSS Custom Properties in Modus Web components
Automate Builds for separate Angular output versions
description:
**Describe the solution you'd like**
The Angular components are built out for version 13 but could be useful for versions 13+ as well. Figure out how to handle multiple versions.

~We may consider outputting multiple packages with multiple workspaces:~
~`angular-13-workspace` -> `@trimble-oss/modus-angular-13-components`~
~`angular-14-workspace` -> `@trimble-oss/modus-angular-14-components`~
~etc...~

~This way we can keep the package versions in sync with the web components package like~
~`@trimble-oss/modus-angular-13-components@1.0.9`~
~`@trimble-oss/modus-angular-13-components@1.0.9`~

With a microfrontend use case it seems necessary for these framework integration package versions to be parallel with the web components package since the browser will only register the web components once at a single version

> This idea has changed a bit, check the discussion below

---

**Progress**
- [X] Create new branch `output-target/ng13`. This naming convention can be used to add branch protection rules for all output target branches
- [X] Add branch protection for `output-target/*` that match the protection rules of the default `main` branch
- [X] Upgrade `main`'s Angular output to Angular 14 - [Completed](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/pull/626/files)
- [X] Update `main`'s Angular package config to include the pre-release flag: `@trimble-oss/modus-angular-components@0.1.11-1411` - [Completed](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/pull/626/files)
- [x] Release `@trimble-oss/modus-angular-components@0.1.11-1411`
- [ ] Update `output-target/ng13` to include the pre-release flag: `@trimble-oss/modus-angular-components@0.1.11-1330`
- [ ] Release `@trimble-oss/modus-angular-components@0.1.11-1330`
- [ ] Update docs explaining the branching definitions

---

**Questions**
- How should we structure the GitHub actions?

title: Dynamic icons inputs
description:
**Describe the solution you'd like**
Some components require the user to pass in which icon they want to use as a slot. Since they are able to pass any HTML element into the slot that they would like, it may be better to have them pick from our existing icons by passing a string.

This could also be useful for components that have fixed icons but could benefit from dynamic icons.

We would probably want some internal component that will switch out the icons depending on the string passed in.

**Additional context**
For example, instead of this usage
```js
<example-component>
    <svg slot="some-name" />
</example-component>
```

it would be something like this
```js
<example-component icon="some-icon-name" />
```

title: Automate Changelog
description:

We can use a GitHub Action:
https://github.com/release-drafter/release-drafter

It's used by Bootstrap looks easy to set up...
https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/blob/main/.github/workflows/release-notes.yml

description:

title: The Modus Modal component is not mobile friendly
Text Inputs should support more types (email, url, tel, search)
description:
Text Inputs currently only support `text `and `password`s.

https://modus-web-components.trimble.com/?path=/story/user-inputs-text-input--default&args=includeSearchIcon:true;maxLength:1;required:true

They should really also support `email`, `url`, `tel` and `search `- these are useful for presenting user with an optimised virtual keyboard on touch screen devices and can aid accessibility too.

REF: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input#input_types

description:

description:

title: [BUG] Accessibility Issues with Pagination
description:
**Describe the bug**
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to https://modus-web-components.trimble.com/?path=/docs/components-pagination--default
2. Inspect Element, the paginations are using `<ol>` ordered lists but the page numbers don't match the list order due to there being a `<` button. The current selected page doesn't have the aria-current="page" attribute.

**Expected behavior**
- We should use `<ul>` instead like Modus Bootstrap does.
- The current page should have the `aria-current="page"` attribute (see https://modus-bootstrap.trimble.com/components/pagination/ for reference)

title: Add Plausible Analytics Tracking
description:
It'd be useful to track pageview metrics on the site. Google Analytics is annoying as it sets cookies and then you got to use annoying cookie banner (which negatively impacts performance), so instead we should use GDPR-compliant cookie-free Plausible analytics. We have an account with them and we use this on the other Modus websites. The script is:

```html
<script defer data-domain="modus-web-components.trimble.com" src="https://plausible.io/js/plausible.js"></script>
```

title: Close Dropdown Menu when you click out of it
description: When using the modus dropdown component, the only way to click out of it is to click the button again. We want it so that whenever you click out of the component to close the dropdown. similar to how the navbar main-menu has the hideMainMenu.

title: [2] Content tree - Implement Barebones Content Tree
description:
# Description

Build a barebones `modus-content`-tree which displays the parent/child items that can be expanded and collapsed on button click. 

This content tree will take a JavaScript object as its input, it will not be composable. 

It will take the object and compose it itself using the modus-list-item component. This should give us better leverage for the Action functionality since we will be able to modify the object and output its changes.

It is important to try to define a good input model for these items that can be extended to fit the needs of all the Actions.

title: [1] Content Tree - Extend the `modus-list-item`
description:
# Description
As part of the Content Tree parent issue, extend the `modus-list-item` so that is meets the needs of the Content Tree.

Extend `modus-list-item` to include drag icon, tree arrow, checkbox, left-fixed Item icon, and change right-fixed Action icon to be a dynamic icon. 

Include optional `modus-tooltip` when the item content overflows to hidden.

title: Implement Open Source checklist
description:
Per discussion https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/discussions/345

Get these ideas implemented:
- Consumer-oriented `README.md`
  - This will include sections such as overview, technology, requirements, installation instructions, and license information
- `CONTRIBUTING.md`
  - Running Locally
  - Unit Testing
  - How to develop against a component
  - This will help devs contribute quicker if this is their first time working in the trimble-oss organization. This will include details on getting started, suggesting enhancements/bugs, making your first contribution, submitting PRs, styleguide, and resources
- `CHANGELOG.md`
  - Some users expect to see this. Instead of manually maintaining a list we can just have it link to the Releases page where full details are. (see https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues/31)
- `SUPPORT.md`
  - What should a user do if they get stuck or something is broken? This file could be quite short in content but we can mention that they can open a GitHub Issue if they've found a bug or open a Discussion if they have a question.
- Make sure `up-for-grabs` and `good first issue` are up to date.
- Pull Request Template (in PR already)
- `Code of Conduct`

---
Task list:
- [ ] Consumer README
- [x] Contributing file
- [x] Changelog file
- [x] Support file
- [x] PR template
- [ ] Code of conduct

title: Update Dependabot checks to occur monthly rather than weekly
tables in mdx files
description:
heya @ryan-henness-trimble 

Right now the tables in the `.mdx` files are HTML tables. I suggest we use markdown tables instead as they'll be easier to view at a glance in the source code. When compiled in Storybook they will look identical. Example of what I mean exactly:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1212885/155316370-008cee2e-f980-4233-ae40-20dd44edd405.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1212885/155318104-4140e8a8-3637-40f8-b261-cdd80704ceda.png)


If you agree, I'd be happy to make a PR with the tables converted. It doesn't take long to do in VS Code (you can copy and paste from the web page and then do toggle markdown table to format it with this useful extension:
https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=mdickin.markdown-shortcuts)
Prettier takes care of making all the columns equal width.

title: Make 'Open Sans' the default font-family for all components
description:
The web components inherit the site's default font - we should set each component's font-family to Open Sans to fix issues where the site is not using Open Sans already

We can do this by setting the `font-family` property to the highest level of each .scss file

title: idea: use Prettier ?
description:
@ryan-henness-trimble 
What do you think about using Prettier to format everything? I like it as it helps keep everything consistent.
https://prettier.io/docs/en/why-prettier.html

It works well with MDX files now and I like the formatting style.

We could add a `.prettierrc` file to the root with something like the following:

```json
{
  "bracketSameLine": true,
  "printWidth": 180
}
```

Then add relevant plugin for stylelint.

I'm fine if you'd rather not use it though, just an idea...

title: Reduce Netlify build times
description:
Netlify builds are taking 4-6 minutes and the multiple builds made today are burning through our allowance (1000 minutes per month). We should try and reduce build-times. Anything we can remove or cache somehow?

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1212885/148762964-0248c0c5-301f-4320-9e8e-af330682bfdb.png)

title: add favicon.ico
description: Add a fallback `favicon.ico` to `public/` dir. This will show in Safari, IE and other older browsers. All modern browsers will show the SVG.

title: Add IE compatibly warning message to site
description: IE11 support will be dropped by Microsoft in June 2022, but there are still some users using it. https://modus-web-components.netlify.app/ doesn't load in IE11. I think we should display a message/alert letting them know that browser isn't supported and suggest they open page in Edge instead. I did a similar thing for the Trimble MAPS Developer Portal with an inline script something like this: ```html ```

title: Add meta description
description: would be good to add a meta description so we can get 100/100 for Lighthouse SEO score.

title: Add security headers to requests
description:
REF: https://securityheaders.com/?q=https%3A%2F%2Fmodus-web-components.netlify.app&hide=on&followRedirects=on

It's easy to get A+ score by adding the following to the `netlify.toml` config in the root.

```toml
[[headers]]
  for = "/*"
  [headers.values]
    Content-Security-Policy = "upgrade-insecure-requests"
    Permissions-Policy = "microphone=()"
    Referrer-Policy = "no-referrer-when-downgrade"
    X-Content-Type-Options = "nosniff"
    X-Frame-Options = "SAMEORIGIN"
    X-XSS-Protection = "1; mode=block"
```

title: Storybook - Add Framework Integration pages
description:
Add 'how to' sections for integrating Modus Web Components with popular frameworks like Angular and React.
This will include showing how to wrap a component in each framework, and how to hook up their form bindings (if applicable)

This might best be done by showing all of the steps - from initializing the frameworks application to rendering the 'Hello World' Modus alert, then moving onto more complex components

This is a useful link for the Angular forms stuff: https://coryrylan.com/blog/using-web-components-in-angular-forms

---

- The Angular page is finished (might use some polishing)
- React page is not started

title: Storybook - Update Storybook (when available) to fix security vulnerabilities
description: We have 2 security vulnerabilities (dependencies `immer`, and `trim`) caused by the current version of Storybook packages. Make sure these packages are upgraded when released.

title: Update NPM package license
Update components to match Stenciljs Style Guide
description:
You can find the Style Guide here https://stenciljs.com/docs/style-guide
-----
One thing we should really emphasize is the high-level code organization for each component. This will help us onboard new developers quicker and make sure developers don't have to question whether or not they're placing things in the right place.

1. Own Properties
2. @Element() Reference to host HTML element.
3. @State() variables
4. @Prop()/@Watch Public Property API
5. @Event events
6. Lifecycle functions
7. @Listen listeners
8. @Method() public methods
9. Local methods
10. Render() function

Edit: Taking another look, we may want to come up with our own order. Feels like the higher listed items should be inputs/outputs

title: Improvement Research
description:
Now that the initial development of the component library is finished, let's look into what could make this project even better.

(Feel free to add to this issue as you see fit, or add a comment below)

Some initial questions:
- Is it alright to have both composable and non-composable components in the library? Is that bad for consistency?
- Are the DOM events we have currently alright? Do we need to rename, add, or change any?
- How are other libraries handling internationalization?
- Do we need to handle custom styling better?
- Are we following the style guide proposed by Stenciljs?
- Should we expose more public methods, rather than having the component's property be set?

Other libraries built on Stenciljs similar to MWC:
- Bulmi library using Storybook: https://github.com/Gomah/bulmil

```
MWC Improvements -
	+ Our own CDN hosting
	
	+ Create and consume a shared styling package
	
	+ More detailed docs about consumption
	
	+ Better content for open sourcing
	
	+ Modus Table Component

        + Modus Content Tree Component
	
	+ Standardize naming, and component conventions (style-guide)
	
	+ Dark Mode
	
	+ Better Accessibility
	
	+ Component Responsiveness/Internationalization
	
	+ Wrapper libraries for (autogenerated?):
		- Angular
		- React
		- Vue
	
	+ Installation Demos (repositories, videos, etc...)
	
	+ Build a workflow for getting new components into the library. This would include:
		- Adding a review repository that developers can submit their components to
		- Review and update processes
		- Review -> Design System?
		- Review -> MWC
	    > This could also be a separate library filled with Organisms, 
                    where the MWC library would contain the Atoms
```
