title: Accessibility Research
description:
## Bare minimum
- Aria attributes
- Tab index/order (focus)
- Keyboard controls

## Aria attributes
Web Accessibility Initiative, Accessible Rich Internet Applications

WAI-ARIA helps by adding in further semantics that browsers and assistive technologies can recognize and use to let users know what is going on. 

There are three main features:
1. Roles - The role defines what an element is or does. There are different types (document roles, widget roles, landmark roles, etc.) The ones we'll be focusing on for this project are [widget roles](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Accessibility/ARIA/Roles#2._widget_roles).
2. Properties - The properties define the parts of an element. (aries-required, arialabelledby, etc.) Here is a list of [aria properties and states that widgets](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Accessibility/ARIA/ARIA_Techniques#widget_attributes) use.
3. States - Similar to properties, they describe the state of your widget. Linked above.

One of the questions I had was whether we wanted to have the library consumer pass in all of our WAI-ARIA properties, but it seems like it's going to be a mixed bag. We want to encapsulate as much as we can without hindering the consumer. I think we can set `role`, `state`, and some `properties` internally. One thing I can see the consumer wanting to set is the `label`.

WC essential internal settings:
- role
- aria-checked
- aria-disabled
- aria-hidden, aria-modal
- aria-invalid
- aria-placeholder
- aria-pressed
- aria-readonly
- aria-required
- aria-valuemax
- aria-valuemin
- aria-valuenow
- aria-labelledby (which is used with aria-label?)

WC optional external settings:
- aria-label

## Tab index/order
Tabindex is an HTML attribute that can set an order for focusable elements which allow keyboard focus for non focusable elements and remove focus for a focusable element.

From what I'm seeing, it looks the best practice is to use only values `-1`, and `0`. This is because once you start adding positive integers, it breaks off the DOMs natural tabbing order; tabbing follows the DOMs element layout naturally, and it is best to stick to that if we can.

`tabindex: -1` - Does not allow the user to select with their tab key, but is able to be focused through JS.
`tabindex: 0` - Allows non focusable elements to receive focus.

For the WC, I'm thinking we should set a tabindex of 0 for ones that should be focusable, and then rely on keyboard controls for any further interaction. Let's shy away of using tabbing to interact with the control other than focusing it. 

## Keyboard events
Using Stencil's `Listen()` decorator, we can listen to keyboard events and interact with the component accordingly. Gabe's got a good example in the `modus-select` component.

Using the w3 documentation below.

## Questions
- Does stencil provide a way of setting properties on the host element? This may be useful for our labelling so that the consumer does not need to know best practices, and we can implement it for them. -- Or is this even an issue? There may be good reason to keep everything encapsulated in the ShadowDOM, I have a feeling the DOM cannot access those and relate them.

### Useful links
- W3C has great [documentation for best a11y practices](https://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria-practices-1.1/#aria_ex) for all types of components that should be reviewed before development.
- Google has some good videos covering all of this
    - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Lktz1KXbTOU&t=27s
    - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1D25YXLBBX8
    - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=REVxMvdBYMw
- https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/Accessibility/WAI-ARIA_basics
- https://www.accessibility-developer-guide.com/introduction/
- Chakra UI has some Accessibility built in that I should take a look at
    - https://chakra-ui.com/docs/form/number-input#aria-roles

title: ESLint v8.x update?
Remove vendor prefixes from scss and use Autoprefixer ?
description:
There are some vendor prefixes in the src/ code which may not be needed (e.g. -webkit-transition and -ms-transform).

It might be better if this was left to Autoprefixer to deal with? I'm not certain though so opening this issue as a discussion.

title: Add Stylelint Config to project
description:
I think we should add stylelint and the stylelint-config-standard-scss config to ensure our CSS is linted and is free of errors and bugs.
https://github.com/stylelint-scss/stylelint-config-standard-scss

I'd be happy to make a PR for this.

title: Update Trimble brand colors
Add Toast component
description: Add the Modus Toast component https://modus.trimble.com/components/toasts/

title: Audit package dependencies
description: The current version of `jest` and `jest-cli` have dependency vulnerabilities. Upgrade their version to clean vulnerabilities.

title: Navbar main menu
description: Add the main menu (left hamburger) to the navigation component.

title: Add Navigation component right side optional padding
Emit Navbar item click
Navbar Reverse Order
description: To support countries that read right to left. The navbar needs to be able to render items in reverse order. This includes fitting panels like user menu, apps menu, etc on the screen in the reverse rendering.

title: Fix label containers for Inputs that do not have labels
description:
Check all components that have containers that only render a single conditional,
fix them so that the container is not rendered if there is no value.

title: Add Slider component
description: Add the Modus Slider component along with its unit and e2e tests.

title: Add Input Date component
description: Add the Modus Input Date component along with its unit and e2e tests.

title: Add Message component
description:
Add the Modus Message component along with its unit and e2e tests.

Make sure the component lines up with the Modus Alert component, as they are similar.

title: Navbar responsiveness
description: The navbar needs to conform to the responsive breakpoints in the Modus documentation. This includes things like font-size, spacing (margin and padding), icon sizes, etc.

title: Add Radio Button component
description:
Add the Modus Radio button component along with its unit and e2e tests.

We need a parent component that takes a data structure to create all of the radio buttons using functional components. This is because the radio buttons need to know about each other and also be inside the Shadow DOM.

Our first thought was to make the radio buttons composable, but that causes issues with the styles bleeding out into the regular DOM.

title: Navbar - Notifications Menu and Help Menu
description:
Add Notification menu and help menu to the navbar.

Fix the z-index of all menus.

title: Add Switch component
description:
Add the Switch component along with its unit and e2e tests.

https://modus.trimble.com/elements/switches/

title: Navbar app menu (phase 3)
description: Build out a navbar component for the app menu. It should dynamically render apps with logos and clickable links. Following the spec documented on the modus site and figma.

title: Navbar User Menu (phase 2)
description:
Build the navbar user menu, match Figma design.

Provide unit and e2e tests.

title: Add Chip component
description:
Create the Chip component using the Modus Chip specifications.

https://modus.trimble.com/elements/chips/

title: Add Animation Code
description: We skipped adding animations as we built components for multiple reasons. One being, finding the Modus specs for them is really difficult. The other is that it's time consuming. Create a list of components that require animations along with the animation specs.

title: Standardize icon component sizes
description:
Create a shared const for the icon components DEFAULT_SIZE (probably 16).

Reference this instead of hard coded sizes in each icon component.

Check if any other components using the icons are setting the size to 16, if so, remove that code.

title: Add standard events to Input/Select components
description:
Add standard events to Input and Select components.

Some standard events already work with the Modus components, so they will need to be checked before implementation.

The events that the components should support are:
- onclick
- onfocus
- onblur

title: Create Navbar Component (phase 1)
description:
Create the Modus Navbar as a web component following [these specs](https://modus.trimble.com/elements/navbar/).

Get the primary nav items on with general layout. Further functionality and responsive design will come later.

Code cover with unit and e2e tests.

title: Create Accordion Component
description:
Create an accordion web component modeled after the Modus accordion element.

Code cover with unit and e2e tests.

title: Create Number Input component
Create Cards Component
description:
Create cards using the latest [Modus spec](https://modus.trimble.com/elements/cards/)

Code cover with unit and e2e tests.

title: Create Breadcrumbs Component
description:
Create breadcrumb per [Modus spec](https://modus.trimble.com/elements/breadcrumbs/)

Code cover with unit and e2e tests.

title: Add Outline Button Style
description: Buttons have a an optional outline style that we didn't build into the original button. Add that style and create a new story to update the Angular site Buttons page.

title: Add Accessibility Code
description:
Make sure than all elements are implementing accessibility attributes properly (will take some research). We may want to expose accessibility properties on our components and let the coder set them, otherwise they'll be too generic.

We forgot to add accessibility code for the following, go do that now (break this story down into smaller ones if needed).

- Alert
- Badge
- Dropdown
- Checkbox
- Text Input
- List Item
- List
- Spinner

title: Cleanup Modus Select
description:
Issues with modus-select:

1. When multiples are visible, both open at the same time.
2. Some clicks still fire when disabled (label, text, arrow, etc). label should never open it

title: Create Modus Dialog Component
description:
Build the modus-dialog component.

Code cover with unit and e2e tests.

title: Cleanup Modus Text Input
description:
Cleanup:
- Scss unneeded/extra properties
  - Check whether the `width: 100%` uses are needed
- Component JSX (bring classes out into `consts` for consistency with other components)
- Rename classes for valid/helper/error 'bottom-text' to 'sub-text' in markup

title: Implement Modus Progress Bar
description:
The Modus Progress bar is a non-composable component that should include inputs:

- min value (values are whole numbers)
- max value
- value
- color, background color
- display text (if null, display percentage)

It should animate the width of the progress bar on progress change.

https://modus-bootstrap.trimble.com/components/progress/

title: Text Input component improvements
description:
- Fix the issue where the border thickness changes the height of the component when active
- Add a light border around the top, right, left edges
- Add a large size (48px height, 14px font)
- Add a valid state (much like the error state, except green)
- Add helper text (displayed right under the component. Overridden by the valid/error texts.)
- ~Add the active state borders. Only green and red are shown in the Trimble Modus Elements page.~
  - This will be held off until we get a UX review (the details are not clear enough to implement as of now).
- Take full width of its parent?

Reference
https://modus.trimble.com/elements/inputs/

title: Add Text Input validation properties.
Create Alert Component
description:
Create the modus-alert web component using the [Trimble Alert element](https://modus.trimble.com/elements/alerts/) as a guide.

Include unit and e2e tests.

title: Create Spinner Component
description:
Create a modus-spinner component based on the [https://modus.trimble.com/elements/spinners/](https://modus.trimble.com/elements/spinners/)

Include unit and e2e tests.

title: Create Badge Component
description:
Create a badge component in Stencil based on the [Trimble Modus Badge](https://modus.trimble.com/elements/badges/)

Include unit and e2e tests.

title: Create Select Component
description:
Create a web component in Stencil modeled after the Trimble Modus Select.

- Must include a label and error similar to other inputs.
- Should be composable (possibly using modus-list-items).
- Must expose a value attribute for form use.

Include unit and e2e tests.

[Trimble Modus Select](https://modus.trimble.com/elements/inputs/)

title: Move List Item Icon to Slot
description: The list item cannot render modus icons in an external site. The selected icon should be provided via a slot.

title: Test Vertical Slice
description:
Create a local project using the Angular CLI.

The future use cases of this project may an introduction, demonstration, and instructional site for using Modus Web Components.

Pull down the @trimble-oss/modus-web-components NPM package and implement all of the components on a test page.

Bring in the Modus SCSS files to help with colors, typography, and variables.

The major thing to get working is to ensure that our input components like the modus-checkbox and modus-text-input play nicely with Angular Reactive Forms. [This article](https://coryrylan.com/blog/using-web-components-in-angular-forms) may provide some help.

title: Cleanup README
description:
The README isn't in a great state to be published in an NPM package.

Things that need work...
- Links to component README files
- Redo the structure to be "consumer first" where the person implementing web components is the primary user

title: Create a Changelog
description:
The file should live at the root of the project and be called "CHANGELOG.md"

Use [Keep a Changelog](https://keepachangelog.com/en/1.0.0/) as a guide.

Every release should highlight new features, bug fixes, and breaking changes.

title: Publish NPM Package
description:
Publish NPM package to Viewpoint Azure Artifacts.

Publish should happen after a successful build on merge into the trimble-oss/modus-web-components main branch.

Determine the correct configuration for the Stencil compiler and package.json. Publish a tree shakable library with typings.

Keep incrementing the patch version until official release (start at 0.0.1).

title: Create Modus List Item Component
description:
Create a web component for the Modus List Item element. This element is used in other components like the dropdown and list.

Use Figma as the latest spec.

Complete unit and end to end tests.

title: Create Modus Dropdown Component
description:
Create a web component for the Modus Dropdown element.

Use Figma as the latest spec.

Complete unit and end to end tests.

title: Create Modus List Component
description:
Create a web component for the Modus List element.

Use Figma as the latest spec.

Complete unit and end to end tests.

title: Create Modus Text Input Component
description:
Create a web component for the Modus Text Input element.

Use Figma as the latest spec.

Complete unit and end to end tests.

title: Upgrade @stencil/sass
description:
The @stencil/sass package is currently at version 1.4.1

Puppeteer is currently throwing up warning about @import relating to our use of SASS. The upcoming version 2.0.0 of @stencil/sass is supposed to switch from using @import to @use which may fix this issue.

Once released, upgrade to 2.0.0 or latest above that.

title: Enable CI
description:
The project has a linter, unit tests, end to end tests, and a build.

All PRs should run a GitHub action with those steps included before allowing upstream merge.

title: Add ESLint
description: ESLint is the go to JS code linter. Add it to the project and any specific configuration needed to match Viewpoint front-end code best practices and style guide.

title: Configure Prettier
description:
Prettier is installed with Stencil by default. Configure it to match our Viewpoint best practices and guidelines. 

Enable a package.json script to run prettier.

Add instructions to the Getting Started on how to run it and how to enable prettier to run automatically.

-------
@ryan-henness-trimble edit:
We've decided to remove prettier.

title: Update Global SCSS to Latest Modus
description:
The global SCSS files were copied from Modus Bootstrap. They are out of date and do not match Figma. Update the global SCSS values to match Figma as much as possible.

Component specific values will be updated during component creation.

title: Create Modus Checkbox Component
description:
Create a web component for the Modus Checkbox element.

Use Figma as the latest spec.

Complete unit and end to end tests.

title: Create Modus Button Component
description:
Create a web component for the Modus Button element.

Use Figma as the latest spec.

Complete unit and end to end tests.

title: Stencil Dev Site
description:
Stencil comes with a default site rendered from src/index.html for testing components.

Design and update the development site to provide a place to demo and run end to end tests for our web components.

title: Modus Elements in README
description: List all of the Modus Elements in the not implemented section of the README. Use a header for each one and add a TOC link to each section. Match existing markdown pattern.

title: Setup StencilJS
description:
Create and configure the initial StencilJS project. Read and follow the questions and lessons learned in the [README of the POC](https://github.com/gabriel-piltzer-trimble/modus-web-components-poc). Most of the configuration will be in the stencil config file but some static files (eg SCSS) need to be copied over from the POC.

Configure the gitignore to exclude the appropriate files (including all IDE files).

title: Capability Design
description: Complete a capability design and commit it to a design folder at the root of the project. Follow the capability design starter markdown file.

title: Project Description in README
description:
The README should describe the Modus Web Components project including...

- What it is
- What it solves
- A table of contents
- The major pieces of technology involved
